Overall%20Experience.Review: Please do not go here. They will NOT protect you if you are a victim. They will stick you in a ward, say that you are crazy, expel you, and then let the accused walk around freely. If you want to be safe, do not go here. Please.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Has a ongoing issue with male students drugging and assaulting female students and it gets swept under the rug , do not send your daughters here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think that if you find the right professors, they are willing to work with you to succeed. However, some professors are extremely jaded and no longer care, or they simply don't know how to teach, and I think that the website rate my professor does a pretty good job of informing students who these professors are.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school academically, prepared me well for medical school. Not a place where you can get an “easy A”, save for a few majors. Relatively diverse student body. Social scene revolved completely around Greek life until senior year since everyone had to live on campus. Athletics were pretty bad save for baseball, but that’s not why you go to Vanderbilt. Nashville is a fun town and campus is just a short drive from downtown.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Collaborative environment with world-class professors, a gorgeous campus, and an abundance of infrastructure for innovation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love it here. The professors are all kind and helpful, the campus is gorgeous, and everyone I've met really subscribes to the southern kindness mentality. It's right near the Midtown area and there's a lot of restaurants, apartments, and a few parks nearby. I highly recommend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics, good environment, slightly bad area, but fun city. It’s a great private school to meet people at because everyone is from different places.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved every course that I have taken and have always felt supported within my classes. 90% of professors are awesome and kind. There is a lot of freedom in the classes that I can enroll in, making it easy to take on multiple majors or minors, which many students take advantage of. Vanderbilt makes sure to offer its students several financial and academic resources. I hope to see improvements in the administration listening to the student body though, and moving to uplift everyone instead of oppressing us and the institution’s issues.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best city to be in for college 10000%. Nashville makes going out SO MUCH FUN and the campus life is wonderful - with fun tailgates every fall, on-campus and off-campus parties allthroughout the year and holiday season & of course a really impressive education. All of my friends are heading off to famous MBB consulting jobs, impressive law or medical schools, or doing fabulous research opportunities. It's been a great place to call home!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Vanderbilt University is an amazing place to go to college. The campus is beautiful, the professors are caring, and Nashville is a fun city to live in.

One of the best things about Vanderbilt is the professors. They are not just experts in their fields; they genuinely care about their students. Professors at Vanderbilt have open-door policies, making it easy for students to get help when they need it. Also, academics at Vanderbilt are top-notch, with a wide range of programs and interdisciplinary opportunities. The curriculum is challenging and prepares students well for their future careers. Hands-on research and experiential learning opportunities enrich the academic experience. Nashville, known as "Music City," offers a vibrant music scene, nightlife, restaurants, and cultural attractions. The city is a hub for healthcare, technology, music, and entertainment, providing internships and job opportunities for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Vanderbilt University has been a transformative experience that has enriched my life both academically and personally. The campus is a vibrant hub of diversity, where students from all walks of life come together to share ideas and pursue their passions. The professors at Vandy are not only experts in their fields but also mentors who challenge us to think critically and push boundaries. Beyond the classroom, the wide range of organizations and events fosters a sense of belonging and provides endless opportunities for growth. Whether it’s engaging in lively discussions, collaborating on projects, or making lifelong friends, Vandy has been a place where I’ve felt empowered to explore my potential and prepare for the future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics, amazing professors (even if some a tough). Housing ranges from fine to alright, but dining is abysmal, especially if you live far from the dining halls.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I wanted a Dual Degree program in Bio-Medical Engineering and Electrical Engineering. At the time only three schools offered that explicitly. Harvard/MIT, Case and Vandy. I got accepted at all. I liked the Vandy program better. Harvard hated me for turning them down.

I am also very good at English and other A&S areas. I took an advanced English class first semester. I got a B on the first paper and the professor called me to his office. He said - for a freshman that was amazing. You have potential. With a little work you could get an A and you should consider an English major. Then he looked at by books under the chair. He said "Are you an Engineering Major?" I said yes and he said - quote - "Engineers don't get A's in English". He dismissed me and never talked to me again. I got a B. - There goes the Founders Medal. I was president of two honor societies and got into Mortar Board. I overcame weed-out Organic Chem and Initial and Boundary Values Math - but not the English department.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Unless you have a massive scholarship to go to Vanderbilt or are extremely wealthy, don’t attend Vanderbilt. The school really doesn’t do a great job preparing students for careers and is not anywhere close to being worth $90k a year. The only reason Vanderbilt students have good outcomes is because of the quality of students that get accepted. The majority of Vanderbilt students would have the same outcomes at any state school. The social scene is also not very good and the school makes it really hard for students to have fun. Save your money and go to state school or a better T15 school that might be able to help you get a job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy Vanderbilt't student body and campus life. There is a great work-life balance, and I would say it is the epitome of a work-hard play-hard school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is the very best. A school with brilliant, intelligent, hardworking, and talented students, excellent professors, and endless opportunities. I adore this place with all my heart.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great university with great profesor, however lacks support for underprivileged students. The student life is also greaat with good food and housing however lack of places for freshman to work out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a Vanderbilt alum, I’ve seen firsthand how the social scene can be very cliquey and heavily centered around Greek life. If you don’t fit into a diversity group or if you like to party but don’t get into Greek life, it can feel like you’re kind of out of luck socially. Your freshman year really sets the tone for the rest of your time at Vandy, which is not ideal because a lot of people tend to stick to their comfort zones instead of branching out and meeting new people. If I could suggest a change, it would be to reform the Greek life system. I think it would be cool if anyone could join any Greek organization and get randomly assigned to a frat or sorority. After a year, if you’re not feeling it, you could enter a lottery to get placed in a new group and meet new people. It might help make things less about who you know and more about creating a broader, more inclusive social scene. Overall though, I would suggest Vanderbilt - I just think a lot of reform is needed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: An overall delightful experience. On move in day you are welcomed with open arms by the great Vanderbilt community. Campus is equally as diverse as inclusive with lots of clubs and fun activities for students to partake in. The academic grind can pose as a challenge however, if time is managed efficiently students typically adjust well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Located in the heart of Nashville aka the Music City, I have great access to city life I've never experienced before, coming from a small southern town. We also have free access to public transportation, which is perfect for a low-income student like me. I can also try out new foods and restaurants within walking distance. Being low-income, I also have the option to go to dining centers on campus. Coming from an Asian household, however, the food is a little bit below my standards, but I'm impressed by their willingness to provide food of various cuisine types, from Greek to Mongolian to Vietnamese and more. I would love to see them try Filipino food as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love having access to professors outside of class, which I feel is a unique aspect to Vanderbilt as the class sizes are small. I also have strong connections with friends and alumni through school events and a close-knit environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing college experience!! I love our community, professors, and opportunities for study abroad and career development. The minor programs are great and the university really cares about every student. If you face any problem at all, there will be a dozen individuals checking in with you. Very generous financial aid. Campus food and housing could be improved as some students get really nice res colleges whereas some buildings are old, otherwise vandy is a perfect university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have overall had a great experience with Vanderbilt University, and I am truly sad that it is my last year coming up in the fall. I think that community is something that Vanderbilt does well, as everyone is so collaborative and kind! I think what needs to change is the Chancellor's office needs to hear student voices. Often times, his office makes really weird and sometimes dumb decisions without considering what it will look like for students, and it is really frustrating to not have our voices heard and listened to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school with an amazing cohort of students who are very down to Earth but brilliant at the same time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although my time has been short, it has been a great experience so far and can't wait to go back! Campus life is so diverse and rich in experiences that you can always find something to do in this one
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I’m there, I never have any complaints about life, meaning it’s a pretty fantastic place to be. Best decision I’ve made for myself was deciding on Vandy
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vandy was the best combination of a city scene, rigorous academics, and social life. It was truly a great four years!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wouldn't trade my four years at Vandy for anything! It is truly an inclusive, collaborative environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have mixed feelings about my time at Vanderbilt. As a Native student, I felt that the university provided minimal support for students like me, especially when I compared it to the experiences of my peers at other universities. However, Vanderbilt excels in student life, embodying a vibrant work-hard, play-hard culture, and boasts excellent professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Vanderbilt is an incredible place. I have met some of the most brilliant people I know here, and feel truly inspired by fellow students. Going to such an amazing university is a huge privilege and I could not be more grateful.
Vanderbilt: a top school with Ivy-tier academics, hardworking and intelligent students, and an excellent work-life balance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great, great school! The social life is excellent. I have met a lot. of brilliant people here. The academics are excellent. Some of the classes are very hard. I can't think of any cons other than that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My time at Vanderbilt University was truly enriching. The academic atmosphere fostered a culture of excellence and intellectual curiosity that I found invigorating. The professors were not only knowledgeable but also deeply invested in the success of their students, providing invaluable mentorship and guidance. The campus itself is beautiful, with a vibrant campus life offering countless opportunities for personal and professional growth. I particularly enjoyed the plethora of extracurricular activities available, from student clubs to research initiatives.

What stood out to me was Vanderbilt's commitment to diversity and inclusion, creating a welcoming environment for students from all walks of life. However, one area that could be improved is the accessibility of certain resources, especially for students from underprivileged backgrounds. Enhancing financial aid and support services for these students would further enhance the University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a transfer student at Vanderbilt, I truly feel as if there is a lot of potential to grow. However, with having such a strong freshman year experience, it is quite hard to integrate with the community given the housing situation for transfer students. Good school, not the best for first gen/low income students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Going to Vanderbilt was the best decision! As someone interested in health and the social sciences, I felt that their Anthropology and Medicine, Health & Society programs and faculty were fantastic. The class sizes were smaller than I expected, which allowed for wonderful discussions and opportunities to develop great relationships with my peers. The electives were so much fun too, and I was especially grateful to be able to take courses across the different colleges and schools - my courses at Peabody College and Blair School of Music were awesome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a freshman student that goes to Vanderbilt. My major is mechanical engineering. I can mostly talk about the School of Engineering because I don't have much experience with the other colleges. The School of Engineering is manageable but difficult. There are resources on campus to help engineering students, however, it's hard to locate these resources. Most of the time you are too busy with external commitments. I've gone to tutoring once for calc 2.  Classes expect you to learn the material quickly and then you move on to the next section. No one is here holding your hand and making sure you learn the material. Friends here are super helpful. If you have a question about an assignment there will always be a person who figured it out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is an excellent place to find a great education and lifelong community. Almost everyone I met there was incredibly kind and willing to help with anything I asked. Most of the professors are dedicated to their classes, and the students work hard to accomplish lofty goals. I do wish that the administration had taken more effort to increase social activities and monitor online classes during the pandemic, as I felt my experience suffered during those two years of social distancing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fantastic, great food, great professors! Never thought I would enjoy college this much, Vanderbilt has made life worth living!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love this school. Such a friendly environment and although the classes are hard, everyone here wants you t succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a pretty small college and everyone are connected tightly with each other. Professors are cared and warm hearted. I'm a transfer student and I was really stressed when I first started. But everyone here is really nice and helped me as much as they can.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school with excellent financial aide to help any student secure a world-class education. Very happy
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is great. The city of Nashville is awesome and there is always something to do. The professors are cool and everything is walking distance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The overall Vandy experience is pretty normal, but one thing that is really cool about Vanderbilt is the amount of student activities that occur on campus. There are always things going on, like free snow-cones on hot days or free slushies, etc. One day they even brought in dogs for us to pet when we walked to class. Even if it might seem boring sometimes, there’s always an event put up for students/parents to be entertained.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus, great professors for the most part.  So many events and resources for students to utilize!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt does a great job of creating a collaborative environment. The type of students Vanderbilt attracts are all very friendly and hardworking. Something I did not expect was how competitive clubs are once accepted into Vanderbilt. The classes are definitely challenging, but the comradery among my classmates makes the experience worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduate student in Public Health at the Vanderbilt School of Medicine, I have found the faculty and administrators to be exceedingly helpful and supportive. Within my Masters of Public Health program, a smaller class size allows students to form better relationships and work closely. Additionally, there are many research opportunities for both undergraduate and graduate students looking to pursue a career in medical research. Another interesting thing about Nashville is that the university is located in Nashville; while this city offers many things to do, transportation was an issue. Overall, Vanderbilt already has an outstanding reputation as a university, however, it will only benefit students looking for a smaller class size or a generally smaller university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are unparalleled and the facilities are amazing. I did not appreciate the demand for free work from students that was regularly required by the program and I think the school could do more to minimize the required miscellaneous payments from students. Still, for my career this was more than worth it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt was not the most academically supportive institution. There are several great professors, and a number of professors who do not care about student wellbeing- only making sure classes are weed outs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like the education I am learning there, the only thing that could be improved is the consistency of financial aid awards.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is undoubtebly a very challenging school, but I can say that all is worth it because of the people there. It is so easy to make meaningful connections that help through your four years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The main thing that I like about Vanderbilt is the character of the student population. Everyone is driven to not only achieve success for themselves, but also to help others succeed. If you ever need help, you're almost guaranteed to find someone there that is able and willing to help with whatever you need. For example, whenever I've needed help getting through an assignment, my friends have always been there to either be with me to keep me accountable or assist me with the actual content. Without this spirit at Vanderbilt, the atmosphere wouldn't be nearly as happy as it is.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has given me the resources to succeed in life outside of the lecture hall and lab. I have learned both academic and life skills that can help me in the future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Vanderbilt. Interesting options for classes, lots of support available, a beautiful campus, and an amazing city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus and the overall community life of the college is nothing short of outstanding! Additionally, the academics and student/faculty ratio is one of the best in the nation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt was a wonderful community to be a part of during graduate school. The campus is beautiful and the community so close to good food and culture.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to Vanderbilt in 2019 and ended up transferring. While it is a beautiful campus and I met amazing professors, I found the community to be incredibly exclusionary. The campus is almost entirely segregated, with white Greek Life being central to white student life. Students wanted to be friends with other students just like them, rather than seeking out people diverse from them. There weren't many robust communities outside of Greek Life. Anyone who is not a white student in Greek Life probably doesn't love Vanderbilt--in fact, most POC students I knew hated it. All the positive reviews you're seeing, chances are, are from white greek life people for whom the school is built.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt's admissions page does an amazing job of showing all of the great things about the school. Anytime I need information about the school, I can look forward to the Instagram's student takeovers and the frequently asked questions on the admissions page. If I never run out of questions to ask, Vanderbilt will never run out of answers and that indicates to me their dedication to all students interested in Vanderbilt, not just the ones that have applied or been accepted. Vanderbilt provides a welcoming presence that lets everyone know they are welcome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt's a good school and you will be set in your future career. Some of the coolness has disappeared with Covid and Vanderbilt got used to not having to host unique events that support student life. Overall, it's still a fun school and you're in the heart of Nashville.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a first year at Vanderbilt. The community is welcoming, it's great to be in the big city of Nashville, and there are so many student orgs to make everyone find their place on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had the most incredible experience at Vanderbilt University. Firstly, the freshman experience at Vanderbilt is wonderful in that all first year students live in one of ten dorms in the same vicinity on the same campus, referred to as "Commons." This provides first year students with a great sense of community and camaraderie right off the bat. The school's location in Nashville also offers a wide breadth and depth of opportunities for students, ranging from exploring great food to becoming involved in impactful community outreach. Additionally, Vanderbilt is very much characterized by a collaborative spirit rather than a competitive one, as students enjoy studying together and helping one another find success. As a result of all these aspects of Vanderbilt, the students at this school tend to be extremely happy and fulfilled by their academic and social experiences here. I cannot say enough positive things about my time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a great university. The class sizes aren't too big, so there is lots of potential for student-professor connection.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors at Vanderbilt are incredible. They truly care about you as a human being and your mental health. The students are also caring and will stay hi to you when you walk by 9 times out of 10. However, the Greek Life scene is bigger than advertised up front. Otherwise, the school as a whole is beautiful and a great place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its been challenging but as long as you have a study routine you'll be fine. The people are nice too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overly competitive and STEM students look down on Peabody majors, but overall a pretty great place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Be careful and forewarned. While Vanderbilt may be great for some kids, for others it can be downright dangerous.  Alcohol and substance abuse are rampant. Kids who run into problems are largely abandoned by the University. Kids who develop medical or mental health issues are mismanaged and treated poorly.  Avoid Student Health, they are incompetent.  The administration seems clueless at best and hostile at worst.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is overall a great school. They focus on their education while prioritizing mental health. So many opportunities are offered here as well as organizations to have a school-life balance. The people and environment are so welcoming and supportive and Vanderbilt makes it so easy to switch majors or career paths.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The staff have been incredibly helpful and responsive. I do feel like you get what you pay for here. I am more than halfway through my degree and feel the teachers and office staff have been exceptional.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt will prepare you for the professional world because of the top tier professors. When you graduate the Vanderbilt name will open doors for you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loving the atmosphere and academics here. Classes are great and the teachers are incredibly helpful. The multitude of events on campus is great as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great tech scene and collaborative atmosphere. The campus is incredible and all the students are interesting and talented. Food could definitely be better though!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The engineering department has fantastic professors that care about your success. The food is pretty good as well, and there are typically good options fro vegetarians and vegans. Dorms are very nice as well. The residential colleges have big rooms and nice windows. There are tons of clubs and the campus as a whole is very accepting and welcoming.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is definitely a challenging institution but provides a comprehensive education and admits an engaging and supportive group of students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are very challenging depending on your department/major, but in general the students are very kind, welcoming, and willing to help anyone who needs it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus isn't too large, so you'll feel closer to your peers. Students and staff are genuinely passionate about their fields.The  Academics are tough but it's a rewarding experience overall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The biggest complaint will have to be how little the admin listens to the demands of the students. They only care about this business side of things. Whether it's about housing, or dining, or academics, or something else, the demands of the students are ignored 99.9% of the time, and after 4 years, that gets pretty exhausting. Nashville is great if you like drinking and don't mind tourists. But I found that I enjoyed things outside the city way more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY is an institution that has helped many creative minds find a path to success. I am grateful to be a part of commodore land.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt’s focus on research and academic development was amazing from the very first year. The community was helpful and .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is truly an incredible place, with great people, a beautiful campus, and endless opportunities for those willing to seek them out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has great professors and classes that are enriching and interesting. Overall, Vanderbilt isn't too competitive compared to other elite universities. There is more working together than working against each other. Likewise, Vanderbilt really tries to have fun events so students can take breaks, and it makes the last few weeks a little less stressful. However, Vanderbilt needs to have more guidance for internships and jobs. They have no aid for unpaid internships and they don't offer free housing over the summer if you are working in Nash. Likewise, they need to work on making the environment more inclusive and accepting for everyone. It's cliquey and hard to make friends if you aren't in an initial group. And they NEED to hold accountability for the racism on campus that excludes students of color. Lastly, they need to DIVEST from fossil fuels
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt does a really nice job of fostering a community right from the beginning. It is an academically challenging school but creating a work/social balance at Vanderbilt is not difficult—there are so many opportunities to be involved. College can be overwhelming for everyone but there are what seems an unlimited amount of resources to help you figure out your place at this institution. You will quickly find that you’ve made Vandy a home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Phenomenal educational experience, though the social experience is not for everyone. The campus is very competitive and graduates are largely pushed into private sector careers in consulting and banking. I loved my time and was able to make a community of public service oriented people. Financial aid is outstanding.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great financial aid, although they are not transparent enough about the way they will only help you finish technically 1 major. If you need an extra semester for any additional degrees by any chance, they don't give you anything..
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school provides excellent education, a unique social scene, and a truly beautiful campus. The professors are extremely knowledgeable and care about your success while providing rigourus and interesting lectures and classes. Nashville is the perfect college city with amazing restaurants, live music, and fun activities around the corner while staying on campus is a joy as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the people i went to school with- all very smart and driven but also fun. The mix of academics and social life was perfect and going to school in Nashville was so fun!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I graduated summa cum laude from Vanderbilt University in 2021 with a Bachelor's degree in Neuroscience. I primarily chose to attend Vandy for its academic prowess, and it definitely lived up to that reputation. In retrospect, I loved the majority of my STEM classes, and I find that my education was well-rounded because of my required liberal arts classes. The campus is beautiful, the food is relatively good, and on-campus housing is average. Admittedly, I was excited to live off-campus for my last two years (but beware - living in Nashville is not cheap). Socially, I had a great time at Vandy, especially thanks to the liveliness of Nashville, but sadly not due to Vanderbilt sports - this is not their strong suit. I met lifelong friends at this school! Realistically, however, many students do come from wealthy backgrounds, which can be off-putting at times. Ultimately, while undeniably expensive, Vanderbilt is a great school that will certainly work to your advantage after graduation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vandy is a very prestigious institution, however, the price of college is outrageous. The housing is very questionable, you could end up in a high class dorm or a 100 year-old building with documented mold growth and roach problems (both are the same price). This is frustrating for the cost of the school. Also, certain classes are un necessarily difficult and exams are made tricky to lower grades purposefully.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best College ever I love baseball and Football and I love sports so it was the best college for anybody that likes sports. Also the campus is really big and people are really nice
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: A well rounded university that offers a blend of high-level rigor, a bustling campus culture, adventures in the up-and-coming city of Nashville, and a top notch education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academics are amazing and  it is worth the investment. However the University could do more to provide for its students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a low-income college student, the financial aid they have provided has been essential to my stability and success during the course of my degree. Administrators and faculty have also been excellent advisors and mentors through all my years. The anthropology, medicine health and society, and art history programs have been especially enjoyable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Have overall loved my experience at Vandy so far! One semester done, and can’t wait for seven more :)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt gives you rigorous academic with a thriving social scene - set in an awesome city. Professors are great and care about your interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The student-led tour was great with honest reviews of the school! They were funny and very relatable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is the greatest! The professors are amazing and brilliant, the campus is gorgeous, the resources and clubs are phenomenal, the food is amazing, and I just love everything about it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I just graduated from Vanderbilt as part of the class of 2021, and I absolutely loved my experience despite having COVID affect my last 2 years. All in all, the people, staff, and faculty at Vanderbilt were amazing. I felt challenged, while feeling supported. 

Now that I have graduated, I have a great job, I make 6 figures right out of college, and I have friends that I know I will be close with for a long time coming. Vanderbilt is everything I wanted out of college, and I am honestly a bit bummed it's over.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Rising senior at Vandy! My experience has been just as I had hoped for when I was in high school. In my opinion, my favorite part of Vandy has been its extremely collaborative atmosphere. As a Computer Science major, I've received referrals to Google, Facebook, Capital One, and other tech companies from Vandy alumni. I really appreciate all of the opportunities that have opened up for me, and I'm trying to pay it forward by helping out other Vandy students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice people, smart faculty. Vandy has a lot of research opportunities for undergraduate students majoring in science, engineering and educational studies
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I made life-long friends at Vanderbilt and I did well academically. However, this was in spite of institutional challenges such as racism and sexism from teachers and fellow students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt’s generous financial aid not only enabled me to go, but also to have so many opportunities post-graduation that I never would have imagined. I grew up in a lower middle class family, but my Vanderbilt education enabled me to get valuable work experience and eventually an Ivy League MBA. I’m now working for my dream employer. I’m forever grateful for my Vanderbilt education, experience, and the many friends I made at Vandy who remain my closest friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are very enthusiastic and willing to help students in any way that they need. I am able to pursue both my academic and professional interests with support and opportunity. The residential requirement is frustrating as I'd like to be more independent and live in an apartment. The office of housing can be difficult to communicate with and are very unhelpful. The course selection is great and professors have added new ones based on student interests, such as sustainability and green development. There is a nice selection of student organizations and huge opportunity for leadership roles if you take the initiative. I am excited about the new immersion project requirement because this will look good on a resume. The career center and writing studio are great resources for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: This review is from a Vandy Parent. I am so thrilled that my Son is attending this University. The care and communication are top notch. He is academically challenged, but enjoying himself at the same time. I am grateful that they are going above and beyond to keep the students safe during the pandemic AND they are allowing them to have a great college experience. He has had a combination of in-person and on-line classes and has had his own room in the dorms all year. He has been on the rowing team, joined a Fraternity, and has made lifelong friendships. He loves the campus and the town. He says he is truly glad he chose this school and I would highly recommend this University to anyone who is considering it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt was a dream of mine since I was really young. Once I started there, the dream turned into a nightmare. I struggled immensely in my classes early on. I always struggled in education, but always ended up excelling for the most part because of a responsive academic community. For the first time in my educational career, however, Vanderbilt didn’t appreciate my concerns. All they did was send me to the UCC for testing, but never actually addressed my struggles on the academic side. I sent emails, letters etc., but no one on the academic side really cared to help me. It became clear to me once I graduated - Vanderbilt responds to academic struggle with the question of “what is wrong with you?” instead of “how can we help you?”. In other words, they got too excited about utilizing their UCC when I struggled academically and  didn’t want to meaningfully engage with those on the academic side (teachers, deans) about how to best support my unique learning needs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is great in that a lot of the faculty is extremely dedicated to helping students out when asked. There's no denying that academically, Vanderbilt is up there. However, much of the administrative faculty are old white men who often make poor decisions when regarding tuition/fees in light of the pandemic/student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a transfer student to Vanderbilt. The transfer transition support is lacking but the academics do not disappoint.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a top college that gives good financial aid. It's really different this year because of COVID, but college is still lots of fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing experience  staff were excellent  teachers were excellent and great university, would highly recommend for medical field
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Third year at Vandy! The collaborative environment and friendliness of the student body and faculty is amazing. I must say that the the academics are extremely rigorous and the bar is very high for all students so be prepared
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a not so great experience; fake friends, lots of rumors being spread about me... it feels like high school 2.0. People are extremely judgmental and vain. School is big enough that it would be almost impossible to know everyone, but too small to avoid the people you don't want to see.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Once you graduate, you'd give anything for another week on campus with your friends, just the way you remember it.  Certainly there are areas for the university to improve, but I'm proud that students here wanted to push for changes and talk about issues that mattered to them.  I had the ability to build a "custom" academic experience, generally had very small classes and really genuine connections with faculty and grad students.  I miss the incredible opportunities to bond with strangers who became best friends, to try new activities and clubs that welcomed me like family and I miss Grin's Vegetarian Cafe, most of all.

At Vandy students went all out at everything we did, whether it was studying, being creative, pursuing our passions and certainly partying.  This is what made Vandy such a memorable place, was that people put their all into everything, and it really is a once in a lifetime opportunity to get to experience four years there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've very much enjoyed my time here! My favorite thing about this school is the collaborative environment.  You never feel alone here, and you'll find professors and friends who will support you through thick and thin.  The liberal arts education is amazing because I've been exposed to so many new topics that I would've never studied otherwise.  Although I'm here to get into medicine, I've developed a love for studying French, and this school has helped me pursue my passions in both fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time on Vanderbilt's campus has been wonderful.  It's a beautiful campus, and the people are nice.  It's a very diverse community as well, which makes for rich relationships and opportunities to engage with students and faculty from all over the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is an amazing university. I have loved every second I have spent here. Not only am I challenged consistently by my coursework, the organizational culture, and my peers, but I am loved, appreciated, and driven forward by everything at the heart of this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best thing about Vanderbilt is the setting. I chose Vanderbilt over other schools I was accepted to at the time because when I visited, the campus immediately stood out with the vibrance of the students on campus, how they always seemed so happy. The campus was so alive. In terms of academics, class registration was probably the most stressful/frustrating thing. You think to yourself--I'm already accepted into this prestigious school, but it's all based on chance whether or not you can get the class you want to take because there's only a limited amount of seats in this class. Multiple times, it's a required class too. If only they provided more options that matched the demand of people wanting to take the class.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt really cares about its students, and the community is great. It holds very high academic standards, so each student would have a chance to challenge himself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Friendly community, work hard play hard mentality, wonderful college experience, good college town, great professors and students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My undergraduate experience at Vanderbilt was incredible, and I wouldn't trade it for anything. I learned so much in my classes, and it set me up for success in my career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has strong academics, a beautiful campus, and a great community. The financial aid is also very generous and extends to on-campus activities such as alternative spring break trips. Highly recommend. Also, all housing options cost the same, so you can live in a single room as an upperclassman.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt does a very good job of bringing its freshman class in. They have lots of cool things for you to do and people to meet. Once classes start however, these events can be a burden. The campus is very pretty with tons of trees. You definitely do not feel like you're in the middle of Nashville. The professors are super helpful and want to make sure you learn. There are high expectations but none of which are unachievable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduate student in the Human Development Counseling program at Vanderbilt, I would rate the university highly in regard to faculty, program quality and campus. However, I do wish that the university overall would create more opportunities for tuition coverage and student life engagement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a phenomenal institution with world-class faculty and amenities. Students are extremely friendly and near geniuses. A truly collaborative and vivacious environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was a transfer student so I was worried about transitioning. They provided lots of programs to help students find their niche and make friends. I found some of my best friends. Their programs and faculty are all amazing. They are there for whatever you need. I finally felt challenged and realize now attending here was one of the best decisions of my life. I loved the programs, the professors, the numerous on campus activities, groups, and research. They also just started this amazing new program called Immersion vanderbilt that will reward people for doing activities outside of the classroom like research, internships, travel abroad, etc. This was a great experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Vanderbilt was amazing! Even though it is a highly competitive environment, the support system available to everyone is outstanding!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a relatively small campus located in Nashville and I have loved my first year here. The cmampus is beautiful and the academics are consistent with a  top 15 school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Alumni networking helped me get a FAANG internship. Really enjoying it so far but the academics have been a lot of work and a lot of late nights working
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love Vandy. It has the best if everything. Not too big, not too small. Tons of different clubs and social groups. Challenging classes and ones that you can relax more with. Great people. It feels safe. There are tons of food options on and just off campus. And Nashville is the best!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has been a home away from home for me. A 4 hour drive from my family, I always feel close enough to visit, but far enough to be on my own. The opportunities I've found there have been very helpful for my life, both academically and personally. The friendships I've formed will last a lifetime, and the professors I've connected with have been more than helpful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt provides a community for all students to be a part of. Students are challenged in their academics but motivated by the dynamic and liveliness of the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has great financial aid opportunities and is an exceptional institution. Pretty much everything at Vanderbilt is awesome and I am very fond of the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Vanderbilt has been the best decision of my life. Beautiful campus, amazing people, and great academics. What else can you ask for?
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The application process was very good.  The website is layed out well and easy to follow.  I also had contact with recruiters who were very pleasant and well informed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far have had an amazing time, only complaints are the food and the workload, the academics and opportunities are amazing, and of course the reputation as well has been top when talking with employers
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a top-tier school that does not disappoint. It allows students to have a voice, is located in the perfect city, and is academically rigorous. Opportunities abound, students only have to reach out and take them. If you can get into this school, you'd be a fool not to attend. It truly is a home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my experience here at Vanderbilt in general. The classes are challenging, but the scope of resources and activities available to students allow time to decompress and form solid relationships with other students and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love it here. Nice balance of that work hard play hard motto on campus. Studies are tough though so make sure you can handle it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my time at Vanderbilt! It was difficult for sure, and I had moments of pure stress over course assignments, but I learned more than I thought I could and gained a lot of skills that seem to be benefiting me greatly in post-grad life. Definitely make use of the Career Center, because they're always ready to help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is the perfect blend of rigor and fun. For starters, it is a top 15 research university and holds a very high academic standard. Vanderbilt is also in Nashville, Tennessee, an amazing city that hosts more musical acts and events weekly than most places will in a year. There is never a shortage of fun in this fast-growing, active, and progressive city. The school is also apart of the SEC and has D1 baseball, basketball, and football making it one of very few private schools to have such a notable run of sports. All this considered, Vanderbilt is an incredibly open-minded school full of intellectuals that are driven by true collaboration and not harsh competition; an amazing place to study.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is a really nice place and I'd say what I love most about it is the friendly school community. Everyone is generally nice and everyone is willing to help whenever you are stuck. Something I'd probably improve about it is the housing experience. Not so many activities are really house centered although there is an effort put in doing so.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is a great school and I have really enjoyed my time here. You get the benefits of going to a top-tier school but with less of a cut-throat atmosphere than some other top-tier schools have. All of my professors have been very accessible and invested in my learning. I feel comfortable talking to my professors outside of class. There are a variety of resources on campus to help you feel supported and successful in your academic endeavors. They are currently working on rebuilding many dorms, and the new dorms are very nice. The campus food is much better than other schools and there are many different options. The students here are all very passionate about what they do and everyone has a desire to contribute to the community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very good college! I absolutely love it here! I would very much so recommended this wonderful college to my friends and family!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Vanderbilt! I feel like I'm a receiving a great education. There is a positive campus culture and I feel like students are extremely involved. The students here also are truly academically motivated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took a tour about a month ago and it was phenomenal! I really enjoyed myself. Everyone on campus was so polite and welcoming. Also Vanderbilt requires you stay on campus and also helps you find a job on campus!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love Vanderbilt. It is the perfect balance between students who care about their grades and experience, but also are down to have a good time and create a fun social atmosphere. My professors have been amazing as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love my time at Vanderbilt.  The are some aspects in which the school lacks such as overcrowded dinning halls and some older dorms but the school is definitely making an effort to improve.  Being in Nashville is one of the greatest college experiences because there is always something going on.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is full of bright kids, and everyone is insanely welcoming. This is truly a community-based university, with everyone trying to help out the underclassmen, and the professors always being receptive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being at Vanderbilt has been a wonderful experience! The faculty takes an interest in you and is very supportive of your learning and specific goals as a student.  They care.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing city. Amazing people. Amazing atmosphere. It cannot get better than this. So many happy people everywhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Pretty good school! They really make sure the the freshman are taken care of as we all transition into college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a prestigious high ranking school in the South with amazing students and professors. Visiting will give you a modern but also historic vibe in the great city of Nashville.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University was my no. 1 selection when I was looking  into programs for Nurse Midwifery. I am so thankful to have the opportunity to attend such an outstanding program.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is an incredible school with amazing academics and great professors. That said, it is also very difficult academically. In addition, diversity is definitely not the greatest but Vanderbilt does try to make everyone feel included, though this does not always play out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The staff is extremely helpful and they work hard to make sure that you are comfortable.  The school is also very diverse and good with financial aid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the educational rigor of Vanderbilt and the general attitude and environment of the student body. It is ridiculously expensive though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: i love going to school here; the only thing that i would say needs improvement is greater inclusion of students of all backgrounds; the culture of the school can cater more to people who come from a higher socioeconomic status
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: While I was only a highschool student at their summer programs, I still found myself with a sense of comfortablity at Vandy and was treated as a college student with the proper challenges. Overall, it was much better than some other nerd camps I've been to at colleges.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: As one of the nation's top collegiate institutions, Vanderbilt equipped me with the knowledge I need to go into the world and ask the most difficult questions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: First and foremost, Vanderbilt is interested in maintaining a good reputation. They will do whatever it takes to mimic Ivy League schools. That being said, if you can help Vanderbilt achieve that image, they will give you the world. If you do not, they will take your money and hand you a degree after 4 years. Nevertheless, the students at Vanderbilt are diverse enough that you will find a group you fit in with, no matter what kind of person you are.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Ever seen an 18 year old in a shiny new BMW?   Then you know a Vandy student!  The lack of diversity here is staggering.   The rich, elitist, white-privilege bubble that exists here will absolutely blow your mind.  

If I had it to do over again, I would have gone to a public college.  Once you've heard the phrase "C'mon, his parents *only* drive an Infiniti!" uttered, or seen a kid refuse to do a community service project because he was tired of the homeless wanting to buy his new Nikes, you've officially heard it all.  True stories (and you know who you are, a-holes).   

PS - School spirit is a joke.  What are we proud of: a "Commodore"?    A rich, robber baron Railroad tycoon from the 1900's who broke the backs of the working class for his billions, that's what.   If you want to be exposed to non-millionaire kids NOT born on third base (I.E., the 99%ers) then choose better.  I wish I had.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Pretty good, like it here! Great community, horrible food for anyone with dietary restrictions, beautiful campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed each of my four years at Vanderbilt. The start of my career was rough, but thanks to the resources offered at Vanderbilt, I entered my second semester with refreshed energy and an improved outlook on my college career. I have been eager to continue challenging myself and my potential ever since. I applied my new life lessons and not only improved my academic performance but expanded my horizons. Sophomore year, I started a mentorship program through our pre-med society for upperclassmen to mentor underclassmen, and I joined a research team investigating PTSD therapies at the Veteran’s Hospital. In my Junior year, I advocated for required relationship education for student groups and organized on-campus facilitators to educate our peers. I also hosted an assembly at my high school for education and prevention of unhealthy relationships. Inspired by conquering my own failures, I found not only personal success, but also ways to educate and benefit others.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is an amazing university with extremely intelligent students. Great college city and environment to propel you forward in life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: GREAT SCHOOL! Love the students and faculty I have met! I love the food, the people, the courses and everything about it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
What I love about Vanderbilt is the commitment to creating a meaningful & memorable experience. Ever since stepping foot on campus - when I was met by my freshman Head of House and the Move Crew - I've been supported and welcomed. I've been encouraged to pursue my interests in and outside of the classroom and attended countless events.

Sometimes it feels like there are too many things to get involved in, especially with the weight of academics on our shoulders, but not everyone experiences this the same way. One of my favorite things is the identity centers like the Women's Center, Black Cultural Center and KC Potter (LGBTQ) Center who provide students with fun and informative programming and the comforts of home. Plus, can you ever go wrong living at an arboretum?

I mean this honestly (but always a little ironically), Anchor Down!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
1.) Most of the intro classes for STEM majors are weed out classes. Depending on the class, the averages for exams are generally between 40%-75%.

2.) The dinning here at Vandy is better than most. I've heard dinning best during the first year since the Commons dinning hall is so close to the first year dorms. Decent food is difficult to find during breaks and towards the end of finals season. I suggest taking advantage of the Meal Money and the Taste of Nashville restaurants. 

3.) If you ever get bored, then there is normally some kind of show going on somewhere on campus. Alternatively, you could gather some friends to watch a movie in one of the seminar rooms.

4.) Most of the people here are laid back and don't have a superiority complex. Impostor Syndrome is discussed every now and then though.

5.) For STEM majors: I suggest taking advantage of office hours. There is no shame in asking for help, and it's better than flunking the class or having to withdraw.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The education is excellent, professors dedicated. The diversity is nonexistent, at least when I attended. There are different ethnic groups on campus but not a lot of interaction between them. The school's attention to the arts is lacking.....you can continue to learn your craft more as a hobby here or through your own  hard work throughout the city. However, the broad range of access to information here is incredible, and there are a lot of opportunities to push yourself and strive academically. There are pretty much no limits to that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The vibrant city of Nashville makes Vanderbilt University an excellent choice for any student looking for a fun college experience. The school itself is both academically challenging and socially invigorating. The campus is beautiful. Professors are dedicated to their work in and outside the classroom. All sports games are free for students and make for a great social outing with fellow students. Overall Vanderbilt provides a great, well-rounded college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Choosing to go to Vanderbilt is the best decision I've ever made in my life. The professors here are incredibly wonderful and unreserved in helping the students. Classmates are intelligent and friendly. You can tell that the school truly cares about the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is a fantastic place to study. I am overall pleased with the high quality of my education. The professors are the best part.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Only my freshmen year, but I can not imagine attending another university. I'm struggling to do well in classes, but as a civil engineer I would expect that anywhere. The social scene is vibrant, especially if you are involved in one of the cultural or Greek organizations on campus. If you aren't, there are still plenty of opportunities around the school and in the city. I would definitely recommend checking Vanderbilt out, even if you think you're Ivy League bound.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and the tour guides were well-educated with the college. I love the focus on engineering, especially since I plan on becoming a chemical engineer. The campus is also right across the street from Bridgestone Arena, which is pretty great, considering I love hockey and like the Nashville Predators.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the campus and the general uplifting nature of all the students. However, I feel that the whole campus could interact more, especially between majors that aren't as well represented on the main part of campus, in particular Blair. I would love to see more collaborations between music majors and the rest of campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Recalling my time there, the housing is still my nightmare. The housing they provided is just horrible. Plus, students have to live on campus for four years. The rooms are ridiculously small and noisy.  Well, as far as I know, Carmichael Towers were not the worst. Some housing around Alumni Lawn are even smaller and have the problem of bugs. 
The academics are great but demanding. Your GPA could be low if you are not careful. The professors are responsible and approachable. Well, the quality of education is pretty good. 
The social scene is famous for being cliquey. If you are a minority student or international student who cannot get into greek life, your social life is going to be boring. 
Hence, if you come from a mid-size city and comfortable with greek lives, you might have a great time there. For those coming from a big metropolitan, preferring to stay in, are light sleepers and not fans for greek life, I would not recommend this school to you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is an incredible institution that clearly cares about their students! I've felt safe, supported and cared for all four years that I've been here. The students and faculty are kind, prolific, brilliant and compassionate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I LOVE the size of Vanderbilt. I enjoy walking to class and being able to see at least a few people I know and am able to wave and say hello. At the same time, I can walk into a class and never have seen a majority of the students there but it definitely feels like a nice sized community. I hate those people, where I'm from, know nothing about the academic prestige of Vanderbilt and don't know where it is. The social life here is phenomenal and I couldn't imagine fitting in better anywhere else, I love seeing people from my classes who are at the top of the class but at the same time they were at a party the night before.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This a great university that has given me the opportunity to explore differing worldviews in a relaxing atmosphere. professors are lovely and for the most part, classes are very informative.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have talked to Vanderbilt students before and everyone was nice and taught me how amazing campus life is.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The most incredible part about this University is the atmosphere created by the student body. This university was voted the nation's happiest school for a reason, as the environment is just so uplifting, positive, and filled with motivated people who want you to excel.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University School of Nursing. Loved my experience! Great teachers, easy to access, clear cut goals in class, great clinical experiences.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended a summer program for three summers called Aspirnaut where selected high school students were able to do hands-on biomedical research at the medical center on campus for six weeks.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I Love the number of safe spaces here on campus. I do think that there are problems with the housing such as the mold in several dormitories. I also think that the school needs to decrease the amount of electricity we use and the amount of water we waste.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is  a great school with a work hard play hard mentality. Academics are very challenging but there is still a fun social scene.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Vanderbilt University! However, one thing that I have noticed is that while the statistics on diversity is much higher than other schools, the different social groups are very obvious and not well integrated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing faculty, incredibly bright and motivated student body, gorgeous campus, nice dorms, friendly and collaborative campus culture, all in a great college town. So happy I chose Vanderbilt!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
good school but felt like it lacked a bit on community like with the students knowing everyone
it wasn't that tight knit
the campus was average 
good facilities though 
very greek school, not my cup of tea but if you like that it's good for you
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a great school when it comes to opportunity and education. Other than that, it is a settlement. The student body is segregated and has to often deal with racial, homophobic, etc. displays of hatred. The food options are getting worse and dining hall close at 8pm and are barely open on weekends. Meal plans decrease as you move up, so prepare to spend a lot of money on eating out and finding food elsewhere. Additionally, there are certain groups of people that are heavily protected on campus so sexual assaults by these people will receive a slap on the wrist.  Also there are some nice dorms and then there are dorms with mold. Despite the slogan, students here are by far NOT the happiest students in the nation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Phenomenal school!!! I couldn’t imagine myself at any other school. I am so happy to attend. Their financial aid is amazing, their professors are inspiring, and the students are so down to earth. “Work hard play hard” suits Vanderbilt well. I encourage all to apply. You won’t be disappointed!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is a very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, very, good college. I wish I could do this all over again
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with Vanderbilt is very specific to my time as a graduate student which I know is much different than undergrad here. My specific program I have enjoyed the classes and core faculty, but have not had the best experience with the adjunct faculty here. My biggest complaint is the lack of diversity, but the way that Vanderbilt likes to portray themselves in a way where they do have diversity. It feels deceiving.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has a good name and good levels of financial aid, however you don't exactly get what you pay for. Food is good but nothing special, housing is cramped and sometimes dangerous due to hazardous materials or mold issues, and dealing with different offices on campus can be a real pain. If you get past the quality of life issues, the actual education is fast-paced and challenging, which is why I stay.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Phenomenal university. Great campus. Great professors. Great facilities. Amazing opportunities to learn and experience. Intelligence and inspirational peer group. In the heart of Nashville.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is a rigorous school with many opportunities to further your education and career aspirations. I personally found a lot of personal and academic fulfillment here. While classes are difficult, you can find professors, advisors, RAs and friends who are willing to listen and help you be successful. They've either been in your shoes or are currently struggling with you. Campus life is diverse. There's something for everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent welcoming and freshman support. Strong administration procedures for class registration and dorm life. Very challenging math and science classes. Some help available but the advisement and counseling can be improved with more student centered tutoring. A shuttle system is available but its function during holiday airport transits not easiest to utilize.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The dorms are horrible to start with and the school administration does everything in their power to suck money from the students. The school is now making all students live on campus however their dorm that is housing 600+ students is not ready for the new year. Absolutely terrible. They also don’t let anyone live off campus, so if you were hoping to have fun in college, don’t apply here. On top of that, the academics and D1 sports really are average. Half the professors can’t speak English or are too focused on their own research / lives to teach a class well. After having been here for over 2 years, I wish I had known how bad this school was before I applied and would transfer if it wasn’t already too late.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: A beautiful campus full of students who are super friendly. Great community, great food.  The teachers are also usually very helpful as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved all of the opportunities that Vanderbilt provides to allow students to pursue their interests whether that be undergraduate research, outdoor clubs, or social justice movements.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt was a fantastic insitution with a fantastic student body. There were a multitude of opportunities for growth and learning. They are also very generous with their financial aid options! I truly enjoyed my years at Vandy and would do back in a heartbeat.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I will do try to best my level. Vanderbilt university is very good and nice place. All teacher is good and they always teach nicely. I like this university, professor also teach well. Lastly I say one things if colleges and university is good he /she will get good knowledge . Do we good and be good
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is a great university that offers lots of diverse opportunities for students inside and outside of the classroom. Vanderbilt continues to work to make research, study abroad, and volunteer experiences more accessible to all students. The Vanderbilt name is also well respected wherever you go and graduate schools and employees look favorably towards Vanderbilt grads.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors are too caught up in making classes unnecessarily difficult. Students are under a lot of stress and pressure to perform well in impossible tests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Vanderbilt and would encourage anyone to attend. Nashville is a lovely city and Vandy sits right in the middle of it. The people in Nashville are fantastic and the demographic of the university fits the city. The education is first rate and anyone that is lucky enough to be able to attend would be choosing wisely.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt is built for a specific type of student, and it really does help you figure out the type of student that you are. Make aware of your goals before you attend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am admitted to the school of nursing in preparation mode for classes to begin. The organization of the program is excellent with details, ease of navigation, accessible to staff and professiors, and the provide so many resources for your success!
