They have thought of everything, so I can prepare to the fullest and once on campus, I will be able to focus on learning and achieving my degree.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt University is a top-notch program with professors who are committed to your learning and peers who are well-rounded, intellectual, and passionate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love it here, work hard play hard. Professors are amazing and everyone here has a story worth hearing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university offers so much to the students: professors are truly approachable, great mentors throughout campus, resources for student showcases, and administration is receptive to student needs. However, the culture is very demanding, expecting students to excel in all areas - academics, campus life, leadership, services, physical fitness, and social life. Can make it very difficult to take a break.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy my time currently at Vanderbilt University because there are a variety of activities to get involved with. All the people here are super nice while the professors seem to be interested in their subjects of teaching as well. Plus we're in Nashville where the food is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I finished my Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering Department at Vanderbilt University in 2017. Vanderbilt University provides me excellent opportunity to be a professional engineer right now. I am very happy to be Vanderbilt Member and never forget this times in my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vandy is a great rising star in the world of elite colleges. It still retains a lot of its individual character as an SEC school with a thriving social scene in Nashville which is also growing a lot. At the same time, the academic competitiveness is rising which sometimes conflicts with the non-academic aspects of the university and poses a challenge to administrators.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: For graduate school, Vanderbilt is a top University that will give you excellent training, education, and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredible experience with down to earth, nice peers and a work hard/play hard mentality. Attending Vanderbilt Undergrad was the best choice I ever made.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I see Vanderbilt as a place that encourages people to define themselves ahead of their future. Hence, it is a haven for prolific athletes, ingenious scientists, brilliant engineers and creative entrepreneurs. It is also work hard-play hard environment which makes it one of the most relaxing colleges.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is an amazing place for people to explore different opportunities in life. I also love it because it has a great atmosphere for relaxing and hanging out with friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like it a lot. The school is hard but it is cooperative and the teachers are generally really qualified and it's not like other hard schools where there is no social life. Truly work hard play hard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: In the heart of Nashville, nice architecture, beautiful campus. Go to SATCO if you are ever near the area.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vanderbilt has so many opportunities. It is harder to do nothing than to have something to do. If you want to be challenged and pushed in ways you didn't think you could be pushed, then Vanderbilt is the school is for you. If you are looking for an easy A, then Vanderbilt is not the school for you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My sister studies there. She says that it is a great place to learn, where students tend to work hard and play hard. The campus is beautiful-- although the freshman dorms are across the street on the school of education campus instead of main campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: All round terrific college, definitely the best in Tennessee, rivals a lot of the Ivies. Awesome place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the community and support from faculty and staff. The smaller class sizes really allow your professors to get to know you, and if you put in the effort, you will have a great experience here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love my school. From the social atmosphere to the unparalleled academics, it's been a dream come true. Teachers are highly involved and classes sizes are kept on the smaller side.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vandy is great for finding a place for everyone to fit in. There are so many groups and organizations to participate in. There is a high fitness culture on campus that can make it seem like a sin to engage in greasy chicken wings from the pub, but nobody will judge you to your face. The campus is large and pretty, but be prepared to walk. I repeat, NOT CAR FRIENDLY!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved every year I spent at Vanderbilt. My professor were amazing and engaging, I did not take a single boring class.  I have found life long friends at Vanderbilt and also very much enjoyed the social scene of Nashville and the Vanderbilt campus itself. I learned more over the past four years than I have in my entire life.  The classes and professors at Vanderbilt made me excited to learn and more interested in subjects I once found mundane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a grad student in IGP, I find my classmates in general two groups: either very bright and willing to share ideas (collaborative) or just in grad school to postpone finding a job (and party) but don't want to be scientists.  There are many intellectuals in the faculty, but you have to find them in the right class. Some are just focused on trying to be landlords or working with big biotech companies. The undergrads are not very future-driven and their party atmosphere revolves around frats and getting slammed drunk. I have even seen my peers who are advanced MDPhD students, get incoherently drunk, and hope they will stop when they see patients. Postdocs, too. Basically, there is a huge drinking culture, little diversity compared to Stanford, but  Nashville is enjoyable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the fraternities and sororities are really party orientated, but others do a great job of serving the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities are great, but our teams don't perform as well as we would like them to. The fans are not always enthusiastic about going to the games. Having the matching band/pep band really helps for the football and basketball games.  The students are very loyal, they just don't always show up at the games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Personally, I do not partake in the consumption of alcohol or similar beverages, and this is what frustrates me about Greek Life. Truth be told, many fraternities and sororities host parties far too often rather than using said time to aid the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The recreational centers are outstanding in both style, design, and efficiency. Many students not only utilize the machinery placed in the centers for health purposes, but also have transformed the atmosphere into a social environment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Great opportunity to get involved in service and fun
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Big part of student life, games are a lot of fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't very diverse and there have been a lot of problems regarding hazing and drug abuse amongst the members.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Unlike at most SEC schools, the athletic scene doesn't have a large following. Many people simply aren't that interested and our teams aren't good enough to help change that. However all athletic events are free which is a great thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most students don't come to Vanderbilt for athletics, but we still support our teams, who work nonstop to be their very best.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a huge part of campus, and I would say almost dominates the social scene.  It is very hierarchal though which I think creates some tension.  Most White people are a part of Panhellenic or IFC councils, but there are also NPHC (historically Black) sororities and fraternities very active on campus.  Currently, we have every chapter except the Alpha Phi Alpha, Sigma Gamma Rho, and Iota Phi Theta.  The NPHC Greek life pretty much coincides with the Black community on campus, as Panhellenic and IFC Greek life coincides with the majority of the White population.  The Panhellenic and IFC are so prevalent though so members of all races know about the parties and events.  Sometimes the members can be kind of exclusive though.  The Panhellenic and IFC sororities and frats don't really interact or for the most part aren't even aware of the NPHC sororities and frats, which I think is a main contributor to the segregated atmosphere of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know that many people involved in club or intramural sports, but I think those offered are good! Varsity sports aren't as huge as they are at other SEC schools, but football season is definitely very popular.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very influential at Vanderbilt University
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Again, I have yet to actually attend then school, so I cannot give an informed opinion.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We're a Southern school. Doing better, but still so far to go.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
I'm not involved right now but am planning to rush this year (my sophomore year). Sorority houses are mostly for chapter meetings and hanging out, as only the top officers are living in the houses. Sororities also cannot hold parties, and any pregames have to be held off campus or in the dorms of some srat girls. You're guaranteed a bid if you make it to pref night, which is awesome. Formal rush happens over two weekends coming back from winter break, and it's pretty regulated, unlike fraternity rush.

Fraternities are big. Parties happen Tues/Thurs/Fri/Sat, with Saturday tailgates. Rush seems like it would be hell, because boys basically have to go out most weeknight freshman fall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of options, and the facilities are gorgeous, but not a lot of student support. Everyone tailgates, but few people end up actually going to the games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Like at any other school, the students who are into Greek Life get involved in it and love the experience. From what I hear, Greek Life at Vandy is pretty big compared to most other top-tier, high-achieving schools. There doesn't seem to be a particularly negative view of Greeks by non-Greeks, both groups are fairly respectful and acceptant toward each other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You'll see a lot of school spirit and decent turnout for our games. There's also tons of club and intramural sports to try and great rec center along with a few other small exercise rooms across campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse despite the Southern school reputation
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Top notch, inclusive, although it can be frustrating at times.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Love the athletes. Fan support wavers at time for big football games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I hate Greek life and so I really can't comment on the relative quality at Vandy
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are okay - Vandy loves sports but isn't great at them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know if Vanderbilt has Greek life that's truly worse than most other schools with Greek life, but I honestly hate it. The sheer amount of clique-y-ness that goes on sororities is immature enough, but the partying, underage drinking, and repeated sexual assault cover-ups that happen in the frats is so below the character and the reputation of this school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Our athletics are laughably bad in some areas, but pretty great in others. Baseball and basketball make it worthwhile but for the most part, our sports are embarrassing and we don't belong in the SEC.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is big at my school, just not for me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good, but could be better
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not an interest of mine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Its fun to watch, but we are only really known for baseball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Although you don't have to be Greek to enjoy frat parties (which are a very fun time) it's awesome having a group of people to hang out with and party with
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I'm on the cheer team, and the entire spirit program is awesome. The school support behind each of the sports is awesome. And being in the SEC, football game days in the fall are hella hype
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: It is not the most important thing, but it is fun to be involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is not the biggest deal, but people still support the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People underrate how diverse Vanderbilt is. We still have slightly fewer asians than other schools, but trust me, there are a lot. In terms of blacks and hispanics, I'd say we have more than most schools. With that said, there is room for improvement. Vandy knows that, and each class is becoming more and more diverse. Campus is probably close to half and half in terms of political beliefs, we have people representing all sorts of SES (great financial aid), but overall students are rich. Probably fewer LGBT individuals because of stigmas of the south, but a strong majority are open to anyone. Geographic diversity is amazing. We have people from everywhere, and we have been getting more from the West Coast recently, which is the only area that probably used to be underrepresented. Great diversity now, and with the direction of the school, I think we will be one of the most diverse campuses in the country in a few years. Nobody should be afraid of Vandy because they are a racial or ethnic diversity; just because we are in the south does not change the fact that we are a diverse, open environment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's there if you want it, but you don't have to be a part of greek life if you don't want to be
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are great relative to top academic schools. Not that great when compared to the SEC. Still, as a student at an elite academic institution, you can't ask for our athletic programs to be much better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our recreation center is incredible and our basketball team and women's tennis and soccer teams are so talented.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not Greek, so I can't say much about Greek life but it does play a big role in campus social climate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sports (except baseball) aren't really that important to us.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fun and not that competitive, adds to the Vanderbilt experience
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tailgates are the best days of the year
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life= Vanderbilt. A majority of the students are involved in Greek life. If you choose not to take part in Greek life (like I have) its fine, there a lot of other things to do on campus, but a lot of campus activities and parties revolve around Greek life, and going through the process is one of the best ways to make friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're pretty serious about football in the south, so our football team gets a lot of attention and funding BUT our team is one of the worst in the SEC. Our other athletic teams do well, but they don't get the same amount of attention.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For girls, being in a sorority does not affect your social life as much because you can still go to any fraternity parties. However, many guys can't get into fraternity parties if they are not in that fraternity or good friends with some of the brothers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Dressing up and tailgating for football games is awesome, but the football team hasn't been too good lately, so attendance at the games isn't amazing. In the winter and spring, many students attend basketball and baseball games - our baseball is one of the best in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The indoor field house and all of the rec fields are top class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Greek life is a stain on Vanderbilt's reputation. I can say that as a white male that grew up in a rich suburb in California, I was looked down upon for not being a part of a fraternity. The divide between greeks and non-greeks is generally racial and socioeconomic: greeks tend to be rich and white from suburbia and do not receive financial aid. They snottily look down upon non-greeks as second-class students. Greek life divides the campus in a very palpable and regrettable way.

But the real problem is that the culture greek life creates is preventing Vanderbilt from truly being considered an Ivy League-level school. Incidents like SAE destroying its house, DKE getting busted for cocaine dealing, and alumni coming to campus for a football game and having to walk through beer cans strewn everywhere dent the school's reputation. Until it rids itself of greek life altogether, it will have trouble making it to the level of the top 12.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Athletes at Vanderbilt live in their own little world: they often hang out with one another, use their own gym and fitness facilities, and eat separately from the rest of the student body. They are also less academically qualified than their non-athlete peers, and in some cases it shows quite obviously in class.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has been such a positive experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are fun, but not taken too seriously.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are clear attempts to improve diversity by the university. Some have been successful, others haven't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very dominant over all aspects of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school has a quite a bit of school spirit, despite rarely attending the games. The major sports teams aren't very good, but we're in the SEC so we play cool opponents. And we always can get seats!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is huge for both men and women. The social scene doesn't revolve around frat parties, but Greeks generally only hang out with Greeks. There are small Greek houses for every sorority almost every fraternity, but only executive members live there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: When our teams excel, student attendance is great. When they do poorly, student attendance is poor. But students are ready to support good teams and bring a lot of school spirit when they do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are very popular and the student body actively engages in cheering and supporting the home team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: We're in the SEC. That is all. We have quality opponents and games are always fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I personally believe Greek Life is the worst because I do not see its purpose on campus except for party throwing. Unfortunately, it permeates some corners of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The football team is sub-par however, the baseball team is great. The basketball team is alright. Students are mostly involved in the football games even though the team isn't great because that gives them the opportunity to partake in tailgates at the fraternity houses. School spirit revolves around football games. The recreation center is well equipped and frequently used by both student and staff.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great but can definitely detract in some ways from the campus, overall an asset to the school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Rec center is far from main campus but there are smaller gyms around campus in convenient locations
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I mean they're there, and they throw parties. They also help out in the community and what not. Vandy is very greek but I mean you'll be fine if you don't join. There are plenty of people who don't, and you can hang out with people who do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a lot of school spirit and support. Our football team isn't great but baseball is really good! Tickets are free for undergrads which is nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love how rush for girls is only second semester. That way people can make friends before their sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really go to the games so I don't know much about the athletics there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is extremely lenient. Campus police officers are basically there to keep students from hurting themselves. The administration realizes it's dealing with adults who can make their own choices and treats everyone as such.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt has an honor council that deals with issues such as cheating and plagiarism.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is all about making sure that all of their students feel safe and at home. They try their best not to discriminate and to have a healthy environment for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, it is fairly easy to get away with all types of partying if you choose to. Their are security officers all around campus and they will occasionally question you, but generally people do not get into real trouble unless they are publicly vomiting, screaming, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Phenomenal people all-around at Vandy. Individuals are attractive, brilliant, ambitious, kind and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life here does many great things and there really isn't a divide between greek and non-greek. Frats and sororities are not competitive with each other, and people seem to like their experiences at greek events, even if they are not in the frat/sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: All games are free and we compete in the great Southeastern Conference, playing football powerhouses regularly. Football is down right now, basketball is on the rise, and baseball is the best. Other teams, like golf and tennis are extremely good, and students enjoy attending games, although people do not obsess over sports unless the teams are doing well. Nonetheless, sports are always a really fun option on campus and provide a lot of free entertainment. Intramurals are also really fun. The sports scene at Vandy is great! Now let's just hope for a better football season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sometimes I feel like administration can inconvenience students, but it is extremely easy to start clubs and have fun without the fear of getting in trouble. Administration listens to students more so than at other schools, and they tend to be strict in the areas in which they should be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Overall, campus strictness is properly administered.  However, there is some inconsistency in enforcing various rules, such as underage drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt administration is amazing. Every decision is made with student life in mind.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the RAs aren't out to get you, so as long as you're not belligerent, you won't get into trouble. However, if you get into an honor violation, there are serious consequences.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Only 6 greeks live in each house. They are small. Greek life is a big part of campus but many people decide against going greek.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our football team is awful. Baseball is great. Our rec center is amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you don't flaunt that you are doing something wrong, you're probably fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty supportive of student organizations and the Dean of Students is really accessible and cares, but he's got a lot going on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Vandy is a very accepting and diverse place. Despite it's WASPy reputation, it has made leaps and bounds in diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The number of attractive people on this campus is ridiculous. However, there is a huge hookup culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you want greek that's great! If you don't, that's great too! It doesn't make that big of a difference on campus. This partially due to deferred recruitment and non-residential greek houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Vandy athletics are okay. Some students are very into it, but most aren't. Games are fun to go to sometimes, but most students will go to baseball or basketball games over football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Admin has it's problems, (There was an issue with salting completely frozen over sidewalks this winter) but over all they listen to students and encourage activism on many issues, especially lgbtq+, sexual assault, race, religion, and safe sex. When it comes to drugs and alcohol, it's pretty easy to be discreet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The dorm visitation policy is really nice; not as much of a hassle as I've heard from other schools. You're responsible if you bring someone in and they damage something, but otherwise it's fine. The freshman housing is dry, but everywhere else has pretty lenient alcohol policies.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They work well with Vanderbilt Student Government to add new things that students really want
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Somewhat lenient but it was unevenly enforced
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Its very reasonable. I wouldn't complain about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the best college athletic teams in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Football is a very big deal, although the football team isn't that great. They still play other great teams in the conference and tailgating is a lot of fun. Basketball games are great as well and the Baseball team is awesome.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: As a graduate student, no an undergraduate student I am not certain that administration is handled the same way in a medical school campus than on the larger, undergrad campus. However administration is easy to contact, responds pretty quickly and are helpful. I have no complains regarding my experience with administration thus far.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People definitely pay attention, but we don't have the best sports teams.  They're a part of the school, but not an immensely important part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Authority figures at Vanderbilt really focus on safety with alcohol use as it is very common on campus.  I find it to be a very good approach, as they require a safety course and emphasize that you should take care of one another when drinking.  They don't encourage drinking, but they acknowledge that it happens and encourage students to be safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not involved, but a lot of people here love it.  The Greeks are good and have required service hours and are on campus.  Sororities aren't really allowed to have their own houses by some dumb Tennessee law, somebody should do something about that.  A lot of people really do absolutely love Greek life here, I just don't know much about it myself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: In my experience Vanderbilt is not all that strict.  They aren't going to search your room randomly and as long as you aren't on the freshman side of campus they aren't going to care if you have alcohol in your room. As long as you aren't destroying property or greatly offending another group on campus with your actions the administration isn't going to get involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: For a private school, lots of the guys are damn attractive. Not only do they have great physiques; they dress well, too. Girls, I heard, were even better and fall into either the southern beauty or california girl category.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Mostly wealthy whites wearing designer clothing, especially the Greeks. Students generally dress the same way: for guys, it's polos, boat shoes, and brightly colored pants/shorts; for girls, it's headbands, leggings, boots, and scarves. 

Most of the gays and liberals are segregated to McGill. The rest of the school seems pretty evenly split or apathetic.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If the Greek scene is for you, it's definitely there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't had any complaints or negative experiences with authorities, but that's because I do not drink or party too much. The only complaint I have regarding visitation is that the hours should be extended. If residence hall lockdowns are to begin at 8 pm, let it be during the weekends rather than on Thursdays. Also, allow students with a Vanderbilt ID to enter all the residence halls, regardless of whether they live there or not. It's not fair for me to be denied access to Towers 1/2 when my residence hall does not have any laundry facilities, nor is it fair to be denied access to Towers 3/4 when the munchie mart, a public student facility, is in there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We won the world series for college baseball, but we're not good at football in the SEC.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities don't rush until second semester, so girls already have their group of friends. This means not all friends come from the same sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's huge team pride in the Commodores... Football is a huge sport for VU
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Again, don't really know since I'm not on campus and I'm a grad student.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Great athletics and also very interesting to watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Greek students are not views differently by non-Greeks and vice versa. Everyone gets along rather well. There are multiple greek housing options from dorms to actual greek buildings.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: they built an indoor field but varsity teams never use. anyone can go in and do whatever. pretty awesome. football's...improving. baseball's a big deal once the season starts.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: frat stuff is pretty big during the fall because rush is all semester. fun stuff. not the only thing to do though
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic program is good considering the size of the school. I think they are working hard to improve Vanderbilt athletics overall.  Club sports are great!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek houses only house officers.  Rush is in the spring, but guys must work the party circuit throughout the fall for any hopes of getting bids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty big at Vandy. You don't have to be apart of it to fit in, but a lot students will join. If you don't join you can certainly still have friends who are in sororities or frats. Greek life is prominent here, but it doesn't control your life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not very strict.  As long as you work hard and do well in school, they let you have fun
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life was the best part of my time at Vanderbilt.  The relationships and social skills you gain in greek life will probably be one of the most valuable things you take from college and will serve you well for the rest of your life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: REgistering parties and beer rules is pretty asss
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
The average male student has one look: backwards baseball cap, tshirt, cargo shorts, Sperrys. The average girl? Three quarters exercise pants, big tshirt, running shoes. At first glance, the average student on campus looks very attractive. Delicious even. As soon as partying weekends hit or classes start, you will no longer think them attractive and you are left wondering how in the hell they managed to get accepted by Vanderbilt. The average student is preppy, only interested in makeup and boys, lazy, disgusting pigs, sleep around like nobody's business, always out partying, rude, stuck-up and prissy, and most likely a psych major. 

Now, the non average student, which they are kind of hard to find on occasion, are cool, classy and chic. Easy going, interested in chilling and just talking, not huge on the 'get drunk until we pass out' scene. Basically, pretty much the opposite of the average student, and waaaaaaay better to hang out with.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Strictness is high in the wrong things. The campus is strict on honor code, going to classes, consternation with professors and the like, yet they aren't as strict on underage drinking and how LOUD the campus is on a regular basis on weekends.

Rarely do I see police officers on campus. Burglaries and muggings are frequent on and near the campus, and we don't receive conflict resolution emails so I believe there haven't been any conflict resolutions. 

If students live anywhere near the freshman dorms or frats and sororities, they should find a friend who lives far from there to stay with on the weekends. The noise is INCREDIBLE. Students just don't care because the adults don't care. 

In addition, there are many underage students who end up in the hospital regularly with alcohol poisoning, but the school keeps letting them off the hook, and the pattern continues.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
We're not bad, we're not good. (Save for baseball!) 

Team performance in general is average. We don't stand out in our division and in competitions, we don't last very long. There are some key athletes who truly deserve spotlight for being the support and foundation of the team, but because of the rest of the players, arguably, they are limited in what they can achieve. There is barely any fan support. Students will pre-game and attend the beginning of the big games and party when we win, but they rarely show up to most of the games. School spirit is high, but actual fan support is incredibly low. 

Training facilities are great and open to the general public. I've used it a couple times and have to say that the equipment is not brand new, but still in great condition and safe for everyone. Master classes and other activities are available for us non-athletes or no-longer-athletes and widely used.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The students are pretty much what you would expect from a wealthy school in the South. A lot of them are far too concerned with the social scene and what people think of them. They spend too much money, and they do not make real relationships. They are mostly artificial, and it can be hard to find a real person, but it certainly is not impossible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think the things that they are strict on are the things that most students have a tendency to not violate, so they feel that they can be strict because there will be no backlash and no fighting. The things that most students violate tend to be glazed over, or they just look the other way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life at the school can be really intimidating, especially for students who don't drink or students at a lower income.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We just redid our athletics facility and I'm excited to see the renovations
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know anything about greek life, so I'm probably not a reliable source in this area.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't spent a lot of time on the undergrad side of campus, but I've noticed a lot of different types of people on the Peabody side of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There's all kinds of people here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a fair amount of diversity across campus. It is often overshadowed by the dominant Greek scene which has little-to-no diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sometimes it can seem a little much, but being in Nashville forces the school to enact additional safety precautions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at Vanderbilt is shallow and is only concerned with reputation. It promotes racism, anti-Semitism and is the reason many students decide to transfer. Greek life offers little to the Vanderbilt community other than great nightlife.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: SEC football is a lot of fun, but no other sport on campus gets much attention. Baseball and basketball at times, but nothing else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not Greek and I'm happy with that decision. But I understand why many are...it's a way of life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Unfortunately, a lot of students miss out on varsity sport games because they are "too busy" with other things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is "diversity" (goodness I hate that word), but most different "groups" segment themselves off.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The fan culture at Vanderbilt has undergone enormous intensification in my four years.  Football, baseball and basketball are becoming especially popular, but it is still nowhere near the level of many bigger schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: While the campus is not extraordinarily diverse, there are social pockets that really celebrate diversity.  Besides that, the more homogenous student population tends to be fairly accepting of various racial, religious or gender backgrounds.  Obviously no social organization is perfect, and there are detractors, but Vanderbilt generally tends to have a 'live and let live' attitude regarding diversity, contrary to its stigma.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The Vanderbilt Police are a joke and RAs are usually pretty easygoing.  I've seen RAs partying with their hall mates even though they were underage.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's very competitive getting in and it restricts your social circle once you're in.  Only certain frats and sororities hang out with each other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The WASPs pretty much have control over the campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is an SEC school and we are devoted to the future success of our sports teams. Football and basketball are two of the greatest things about Vandy; athletics unite the entire campus with the local community and with alumni. Sports games are an essential part to the SEC experience. Go Dores.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls here are both attractive and intelligent. Everyone here is friendly and motivated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity here is much greater than given credit for. People of all races, beliefs, religions etc. The geographical diversity is also amazing; people are from all over the map.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very lax environment; the school overall is not strict, and trusts the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
The Greek Life at Vanderbilt might be some of the greatest in the country. The smaller school size (as compared to a state school) allows you to know (or at least be aware of) basically everyone who's involved in the Greek community. Despite having a smaller student population than big state schools, there are a comparable number of Greek House; this allows for a greater chunk of the students to get involved.

For guys, the entire first semester is dedicated to rush, which makes the first year is an incredible experience. This lengthy rush season and general lack of regard for "legacy status" (it does matter at a few houses) allows the students to be sorted into the Fraternities in which they would fit in best.

For girls, the first semester can be nerve-wracking with limited permissible communication to and from Sorority members. The rush is hectic but has a very regular 2 week time-frame.

The University does not allow Greek housing for more than 6 people per house. This can be seen as positive or negative, depending on the person.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is sometimes considered a "Conservative School," which is true when comparing it to other schools (which are predominantly Liberal); however, it is in reality very neutral. It's a nice place to be if you want to avoid having a liberal agenda shoved down your throat.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is not that strict, they offer a lot of freedoms in regards to normal living situations.  I live in a co-ed house this year which I really enjoy, and there aren't really any strict rules about visitation or like curfew or anything.  They are strict about the honor code, but it's not like they're out to get you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our athletics program, particularly our football program, has been growing and becoming increasingly impressive over the years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is not much diversity on campus.  There may be diversity in regards to numbers on paper, but the diversity is not evident when walking around campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are rules but aren't strictly enforced.  Basically don't be a complete dumbass and you'll be fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is not diverse in the conventional sense. Yes there are people from all over the world of all different races and Vanderbilt, but it is the diversity of ideas and values that amazed me. It makes for extremely interesting conversation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football games are extremely fun and the athletic facilities are fairly accessible and up-to-date.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls are HOT...but surprisingly religious/not entirely up for weeknight partying.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Depends on your RA (for freshmen at least) but most are pretty chill as long as you're not trying to throw a giant party in your dorm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is BIG. You dont quite realize everything that happens at Vandy because of the Greek system until you join.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Super hot, lots of variety
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Focused on safety, not enforcing rules.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have friends from many countries, religions, etc
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Just built a huge new athletic facility at the rec
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Football is big here, and most students attend the tailgates and games on weekends during the season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We aren't super diverse, but minority students are 100% accepted and treated just like everyone else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls are absolutely gorgeous, but the guys are mediocre (& sometimes jerks despite the fact that they're not hot).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't rushed yet so I'm not an expert on Greek life, but it seems to be pretty inclusive and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls are incredibly hot as well as surprisingly very smart.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life basically runs campus.  You can still have fun without it but there's no reason not to.  There's a sorority or fraternity for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A great variety of different political, religious, and ethnic backgrounds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone on campus rallies behind the football team no matter the weather, the opponent, or time of the game.  If the game is a 3:00 PM game, you're guaranteed to see loads of people drinking at the fraternities by 6:30 AM.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Every girl here is beautiful. Seriously every single one to the point where I think they stalked facebook to decide who to let in and who to deny (I'm joking....maybe). Every girl here is extremely hard working and smart and wants to succeed, and also party on the side. Most people here dress up really nicely, lots of sundresses and no one wears sweats to class. Freshmen usually wear some form of high brand pants skirts sweaters boots sandals to class whereas upperclasssmen girls wear their sorority clothes pretty much everywhere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Economically, because of how financial aid works here, everyone is either on one side of the spectrum or the other. Everyone is either pretty wealthy, or not wealthy at all, without many people in the middle. Vandy prides itself on aid but expects middle-income families to struggle in order to pay to go to school here and many decide not to make that sacrifice, however, in low income families, Vandy is very eager to help out. In all other categories though, vandy is pretty divers.e
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Literally just don't be an idiot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Personally, I decided to participate in Greek Life and i love it but if you choose not to, you won't lose friends because of it, and if you do, it's probably weird people anyway who are trying to prove to themselves that they're awesome. It's a little harder for guys to find their place and a lot more determinate of their social lives, but as far as girls are concerned that are planning to go through recruitment, they will for sure find a place and girls that they love unless they do something really stupid to mess it up. fraternity parties are pretty much the gut of the social scene at vandy but for girls, even if you aren't greek you can totally take part. greeks throw events all the time and are really involved in community service. i'm not non-greek so i don't really know what they think about us but i think everyone realizes that everyone has a place where they fit in and everyone can make that decision on their own without being judged. only 6 people live in each house and they're all officers which is cool because even if your friends aren't in the same organization as you, you can still live together and see them all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All of our teams are getting a lot better, and because our school community is so close it's hard not to support the kids that play on the teams because they're your friends outside of the classroom too. We have sooo much school spirit it's kind of scary sometimes, and if game attendance is low, it's probably because we all just tailgated too hard before it and are at some bar somewhere watching it on TV, too tired to keep standing after dancing on elevated surfaces for four hours. Also, we have a really athletic student body so the facilities are used often by everyone. The rec has great machines, and especially for girls, there's a gym above commons that is referred to as the "Estrogym" as it's full of treadmills, stationary bikes, and ellipticals.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls are usually friendly? I don't know. Most everyone is friendly
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We're not the best but we do have a lot of school pride here
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's definitely a big thing here. Only chapter officials live in the houses - but they're nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most kids are white, upper class, heterosexual, and conservative.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not part of Greek life but I definitely do not feel excluded. Many of my friends take part in it, and I still hangout with them as much as I do with my friends who are not in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is someone for everyone here, some kids date and some hookup, its all about meeting the right person. Mostly people here are just interested in meeting friends, friends with benefits are popular too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Within reason, you can do anything at Vanderbilt.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Even if we don't win, the whole school is booming with school spirit and supports the teams. You can feel it the minute you step on campus, this spirit driven by athletics gives Vanderbilt the edge on other top liberal arts colleges without D1 sports. SEC in the south, enough said.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The best greek life you'll get at a top twenty school. Fun parties, people go out at least 3-4 nights a week. Parties feel safe and fun, never short on alcohol or good music. Top tier frats and sororities only hangout with each other, and most non greeks are social awkward or international kids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life here is very prevalent. About 50% of girls are in a sorority and 30% of guys in a fraternity. Frat parties dominant weekend activities. You aren't socially excluded for being in a frat or sorority, but there is less connection to the party scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Immunity rule makes it difficult to a student to get in trouble for seeking help for themselves or others. Parties get shut down in the Commons, but rarely in off campus or main campus events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Both guys are girls are extremely attractive. Both are very into partying, and the hookup scene is most prevalent. Hard to find a guy who wants to be more than friends with benefits.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football, baseball, and basketball are huge. women's basketball esp.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Vandy represents over 170 countries. i didn't even know there were that many
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: All are good looking. most of money too. partying is a big deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not really strict. The police aren't around when most crimes happen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's a diverse college with a major influence on greek life
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They actually let you do a lot. Vanderbilt is pretty liberal like that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Though it's not quite there yet, Vanderbilt is on the up and up when it comes to recruiting a diverse population of students (race wise). The MOSAIC program is unrivaled in my opinion. Vanderbilt is actively trying to increase diversity. I know we have a reputation of being white/preppy/southern but I think that's about to change in the next few years. I will say however that there is a disproportionate amount of affluent students. I feel that many of the students seem disconnected from real world problems because they are primarily upper-middle class or rich. Religious diversity needs some work too. May have just been coincidence but most of the people I met last year were Catholic or Jewish. Then again, most top tier universities have this problem.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The VUPD is there mainly to make sure students are safe, not to ruin the fun. If you want to have loud parties and beer in your room, you can. Just don't go too overboard. Alcohol is allowed on campus if you're of age, but you won't get busted for underage drinking unless you're completely out of control.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics have been improving recently at Vandy. As a member of the SEC, the school is involved in the best college sports in the nation. The football team has gone to bowl games two years straight and is recruiting better players every year. The basketball team won the SEC championship in 2012 and is a semi-regular NCAA tournament team. The baseball team is consistently one of the best in the nation. Students do not have to pay to attend any sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are definitely big and getting bigger as our football team improves each year. School spirit is prevalent and there are always fans at football, basketball, and baseball games. The student athletes have their own dining hall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our teams are good, but not a lot of school spirit. The athletic facilities aren't as good as those for a state school but much better than most private schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Your typical Vanderbilt student is a rich, white southerner. As a black middle-class student, I guess you could say I stick out. Diversity isn't terrible (I have two Asian friends!), but it certainly isn't great. If you cannot stand guys who pop their collars and talk about how rich their fathers are, then this isn't the school for you. Personally, I find humor in all the arrogant people here, but others can't stand the atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There will always be something to do on the frat row.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: VUPD does not monitor much, only in emergencies.  Visitor rules are fairly lax, and many hallways and suites are co-ed.  Students get free reign of most of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: For people who want greek life, this is the place.  Over 60% of students are involved.  For those not interested, like me, think carefully.  Greek events seem to dominate campus culture, especially on the weekends.  The result is an environment where most people are expected to party on the weekends.  However, there are many other things to do if that is not your thing, such as hiking/canoeing trips, plays, the symphony, volunteer projects, and exploring downtown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We are the only school that can offer a first-class education and have teams competing in the SEC, which is the most competitive conference in all of college athletics. Sometimes, attendance can be a bit sparse because of the relatively small student body, but with the football team coming off its best season in 97 years and the baseball team ranked #3 in the nation, it seems like that will change.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of the students are the stereotypical rich, white "Vandy kids." However, recently efforts have been made to improve diversity, and the student body has changed significantly in recent years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Men's football and basketball are really fun. There is definitely a change in the way that students are supporting athletics. They're becoming a bigger deal now!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Part of the SEC so even if Vandy is not having a great year the visiting teams are tops in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life completely dominates Vandy, especially for girls. 50% of girls join sororities, which doesn't seem like that many but in reality it overwhelms the social scene. Greeks love being Greek.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have some great teams, but sometimes the school spirit gets lost.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Vanderbilt is a lot more diverse than the stereotype it is given. I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of diversity I found here. There is a lot of ethnic/racial diversity. Many people are on scholarships and financial aid leading to a more socioeconomic diversity. The school is pretty balanced between Republicans and Democrats. There is definitely religious diversity and acceptance. There is some diversity of sexual orientation and Vanderbilt definitely tries to promote acceptance of diverse sexual orientations. Overall, Vanderbilt has done a good job with their diversity, but there is still more they can work towards to improving it, which I believe they are doing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The large majority of the Vandy student body is white upper-middle class. There is not a lot of variety among students, with preppy greeks being the norm. Variety and political beliefs and religion are widely accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know but you can call the Language department for guidance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People are mostly accepting of all religions and backgrounds, but Christians get a bad rap soemtimes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: They are all gorgeous. Plus, there is a wide range of girls and guys here. Everyone dresses to impress, and it's fairly easy making friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The freshmen class come in eager and accomplished. If they stay focused they usually succeed. The upperclassmen are somewhat apathetic since the pressure to stay in school and excel is not as rigorous as the pressure/competition to be accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
http://www.insidevandy.com/opinion/article_67f1bd52-167e-11e2-aa2a-001a4bcf6878.html

A Review on the Vanderbilt Greek Scene that everyone should see.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The majority of the guys and girls on campus can be filtered into elitist, 1%, bros and sorority girls. People don't go out(even for class or studying) unless they look top-notch, leaving a crippling pressure on campus to constantly reach unattainable physical perfection. Social life revolves around the greek scene, which creates this aforementioned, inescapable culture on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm surprised our school is ranked 86th for "Where Greek Life Rules" because the phrase embodies the Vanderbilt social scene. I shun Greek Life, but I must admit, people who enjoy fraternity parties will have something to do every weekend at Vanderbilt.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Attractive, but annoying. A common theme is for an attractive girl to have a selfish attitude to match. The gentlemen are more relaxed for the most part, but show their true colors when they party like wild animals.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There exists racial diversity on campus, but you will be silently discriminated against by most of the white community for being anything other than white or black. In other words, white people will avoid you for being Asian. All the Asians here came because they were either unable to get into higher-ranked schools, or because they are party animals. Most of the black students are here on athletic scholarships. Sad to have to list these stereotypes, but they are true for the most part. There is a severe lack of diversity in interests here. Most people just want to party and graduate with their degree. This is the wrong school to attend for people who want to be accepted by anyone outside of their ethnic group.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Random Representation – Upper/upper middle class white students are over-represented, African Americans under-represented, the foreign students are mostly from Malaysia, and the Christian and Jewish organizations follow Greek life as forces on campus.  Vanderbilt made headlines for determining to uniformly enforce the non-discrimination policy for school-sponsored organizations (the case came up in regards to a gay student's right to leadership within an organization), which inadvertently led to the claim that the non-discrimination policy was discriminatory against conservative and religious groups.  There are still some hard feelings and debates, with the usual polemics and straw man arguments.

The inability of some dominate groups to not just begrudgingly cooperate with others is probably the main obstacle to inclusive and further diversity on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: "Just Don't Carry a Handle of Liquor Down the Hall and You'll Be Fine&quot – Campus cops don't want to get you in trouble, they just want to make sure you're safe. Don't be stupid and you won't get caught. I have heard quite a few places are strict on fake ideas downtown though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Girls Are Hot – The girls are all attractive. For the most part they are stereotypical southern "Belles"
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fair and Appropriate Consequences – Punishments for drinking alcohol on commons are pretty fair. Most of the time, you will just get a warning, but you have to go through a few talks with Student Conduct and your area coordinator.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Separated but There – There are a lot of minority students, but they are often separated from everyone else. People mostly just stick to their own cultural groups. The majority of students are affluent white kids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Great Athletic Program! Vanderbilt has a ton of top varsity sports teams, from football and baseball, to cross country and track, to lacross and swimming. The list is endless. Intramural sports are strong both within the Greek community and independently organized. There are endless games to attend and school spirit is generally pretty amazing!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Although Vandy is making a concerted effort to change this; there is still a lot of room for improvement.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Getting Better – Athletics really have improved over the past couple of years. We've gone from being the basement of the SEC every year to being way more competitive. We've made two bowl games in the past four years (and won one) and our new coach is an excellent recruiter. Our basketball team won the SEC championship this year, and was only one of two teams in the country that beat the eventual NCAA champions Kentucky. Our baseball team made the College World Series last year.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Registration is easy even if you don't always end up in what you want. Be prepared to work your ass off.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Academics are very rigorous and a lot is expected of the students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Every school has issues with professors that come solely for research, but are forced to teach on the side. Judging by average reviews on ratemyprofessor and other sites, though, Vandy is much less of a victim of this. Our teachers are overall better than pretty much every other school, and Vandy does truly have an undergrad focus. In my experience, my teachers have almost exclusively been great. The workload is difficult, and while it is relatively easy to have a GPA in the 3.3 range (except in a few engineering majors), it is difficult to get a very high GPA. The students at Vandy are as smart as anywhere. Vandy cares about demonstrated intelligence more than other top schools in admissions I'd say (other schools care a ton about uniqueness), and so students are pretty consistently smart across the board. Top students, top professors, lots of courses of study, truly cannot find better academics for general arts and sciences/HOD.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: My teachers are incredibly good
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Very good professors, but with a large workload. Registration is annoying.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The audition experience at Vanderbilt is incredible. The level of hospitality and genuine interest was something I just didn't find at other schools (even the big ones like Indiana and Northwestern). Expect interaction with professors, observing classes, students wanting to talk with you, dinner at the University Club, and a student concert.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Blair is a unique place were you can receive a conservatory without having sacr5ifice top-twenty academics. Most students double major or minor, and students are given a lot of performance opportunities. As a voice major, I benefit from a revolutionary instruction in art song and lyric theatre not found in most music schools.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: As a student at the Blair School of Music, I am given a conservatory style education combined with a top twenty research university. Being a completely undergraduate institution, all performance opportunities, masterclasses, ensembles, and one-on-one contact with professors are not taken by grad students. It is also, incredibly easy to double major and minor outside of Blair. It is just as common for a Blair grad to go to Med, Law, or Business School as it is to go study Performance. All of this is in a student body of approximately 200 students. Blair is more then just a school. It is a family.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's very tough, but very doable with the right work ethic.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Very high quality education in offered by my major and school.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm not a part of any program yet (you don't pick your major until sophomore year), but the education is quality no matter what.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Very challenging, definitely requires adjustment from high school for nearly everyone.  The professors are very engaged, however, and very willing to help (and truly do want to help) in almost every instance.  I've had one professor strict on attendance and tardiness, but there is an overarching school policy that all professors follow.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
I have experience in both the humanities and sciences.

Humanities are great: small classes, engaging discussion, and knowledgeable yet humane and understanding professors who are there for you and willing to work with you. They want you to succeed and get as high a grade as possible (especially in Peabody).

Sciences, however, are hit or miss. Introductory weed-out class professors are ruthless and leave you to fend for yourselves against the hard material and even harder exams. This isn't bad per se, but you can definitely feel these classes packing heat and stress. I'm sure there are wonderful professors in the STEM departments, but I have yet to find one. The ones I've had experience with are very hard, unreasonable, apathetic, bad at teaching, or any combination of the four. It's not uncommon to study for more than 30 hours per week on a subject and still end up with a C or B- on an exam. At least my humanities professors were able to empathize with me and give me leniency. Perhaps that's why many science majors look down upon Peabody and humanities students who claim to have a hard time: it's the leniency and leeway they have compared to science majors.

But all this difficulty prepares you to buckle down and have better study habits for next time. Vandy whips you into shape, and you have to slap a donkey in order to get it moving.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My major (classics) is great and pretty cozy. Professors are knowledgeable, engaging, and friendly and can teach very well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Most A&S majors are very easy to complete. Leaves tons of room for another major and minors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors are brilliant and the curriculum is very rigorous.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: We do nursing preceptorships and practicums that allow us to become familiar with the settings we could work in after graduation. These are not paid positions but often lead to direct hiring after graduation.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: It has a great spanned and allows me greater options in terms of pursuing a career.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: you can pick any major there aren't any hoops or applications it's really easy. pretty sure you can make your own major if you want. hardest part is taking the classes.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: the teachers here are awesome and help so much when you need it
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Vanderbilt is a very academically oriented school. The classes are hard, and the people around you are incredibly intelligent. It is different and hard for most people coming to a place where they are not top of the class but average, but in the end, that is what makes Vanderbilt such an incredible place to learn. The incredible variety of people and their backgrounds coupled with intelligence in every student, gives Vanderbilt a very intelligent and academic feel.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Work hard, play hard.  Most workload of any degree on campus but it is also well respected amongst the student body (and with employers)
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Good starting salary. All depends how you pair it. HOD should be great for years to come
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I like it, wish there were some more business-centered classes in HOD, but thats what I take MGRL classes for I guess
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Peabody College is easier to get into than the rest of them, which is nice
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: HOD is growing. Being taken more seriously
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review:
I am in a Pre-medical program and track filled with general sciences like physics, chemistry, and biology and maths like calculus. Some examples of extra courses to take are psychology, sociology, neuroscience, and statistics. I find that the program I am in is too constricting, though I do enjoy it. These courses, though understandable that they would take much of my time, fill out my entire schedule and leave me with no room to pursue other interests in school like ceramics or new languages. Because schedules set a cap at 18 hours for all courses taken, and the sciences require labs, discussions classes, courses, and recitations (and sciences are often doubled up), most of the schedule is taken up with little room for other interesting courses. Because pre-med is not a major, we have difficulty finding a major that won't take up what little room we have left in our schedules, and many of us are limited to science majors.

The actual courses themselves are either hit or miss. Some of the teachers are absolutely excellent, but like all schools, getting into those courses is competitive and all slots are generally filled right from the start, especially if you're in a second enrollment window and make your choices last. So most of the time, you are left with either a teacher who is brutally uncaring of students' outside lives and don't have any qualms squashing them with difficult tests, extreme amounts of homework, projects, and quizzes with no curves. Or you are left with a professor who is highly intelligent, but is terrible at conveying the information to the students, leaving them frustrated and confused for the better part of the course.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics are the main draw for the school, and for good reason. Vanderbilt's professors are incredible, and they are really willing to work with you. The registration process is easy, and as fair as it can be. The workload is tough, but that is to be expected.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Being an education major at Vanderbilt is awesome because it is one of the top education schools, so all of the professors really know what they are talking about and really care about their subject. Everyone in Peabody is so friendly and willing to help.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I did not have any problems getting into the program that I wanted. The most important thing is to have a good essay, good recommendations, and to show them that you are a hard-working versatile person.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There are so many internship opportunities at this school. If you want an internship and you cannot find one, you just have not been talking to enough of the professors, because they will help you.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love my program Cognitive Studies. I also created my own major, which was perfect!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There are plenty of options for majors as well as minors.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I will be expected to have various experiences through community touch points.  I don't necessarily have to have one internship, but I plan to take advantage of my work experiences to the fullest extent allowed!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Admissions folks are top notch. Be yourself.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: There are great and challenging courses, as should be expected, but Vanderbilt does not foster a true learning environment. It is competitive and detached.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Good for some bad for others. Good for premed, engineering. Bad for finance.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Good academics, but I would expect better from most top 20 universities. There are too many adjunct professors on campus, the class sizes are very large and professors are often concerned more with research than with teaching.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore
