Academics.Review: We aren't top 20 for no reason.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Academics are moderately strenuous, but applicants are well aware of the workload that comes with such a prestigious University.  It's been possible for me to double major and minor, so obviously there is a lot of wiggle room.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The process of enrolling in the English Literature and Film Studies majors at Vanderbilt was very easy.  The application process is simple and straightforward, and the course selection was wide enough to allow me to study two majors (and an additional European History minor) with ease.  I would recommend potential Vanderbilt students review major requirements thoroughly before deciding whether or not to commit to a program.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The HOD program includes a semester-long internship where you can choose to work in any company in basically any field, as long as it's applicable to the major.  I'm glad I can do this before I graduate.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Professors are usually very knowledgeable and accessible, and those who aren't are part of a very small minority.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very challenging but rewarding. The professors are wonderful and you learn a lot.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It's pretty easy to declare the major you want, and you can even create your own major if you want.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The HOD program gives you a lot of opportunity for real-world experience, most notably the internship program.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Top of the notch academics--period. Great professors and students are brilliant and driven to keep learning.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Top of the notch academics--period. Great students, great teachers. The school work can be difficult, but it is rewarding, and I couldn't have gotten a better education at an other school in the world.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Vanderbilt is difficult, but I personally love the psychology program that I am involved in.  The teachers are really nice and really care about how you are doing.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Vanderbilt is a tough school, but it is continually ranked in the top 20 schools in the nation and that definitely shows.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Workload is not difficult if you set your mind to doing homework, but it's hard with so much other fun stuff going on.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: People seem to really enjoy the majors they are in.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: People get internships, but it's helpful to kind of seek them out yourself. But Vanderbilt's name DOES carry weight across the country, so students are successful.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The professors are incredible. They have all been very engaging, easy-going, and reasonable.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: So many great academic convos outside class
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very rigorous and challenging, but learning tons!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Work hard/play hard. Don't care about anyone's GPA
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Good. lEt you design your own which is really nice
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I did biomedical engineering. Great course. Not the best, but good enough.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The workload is challenging and the professors are passionate. Getting into classes is sometimes difficult
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Lots of opportunities for internships and research. You have to put in the effort if you want the action though.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great professors. Especially like Hetherington in the Poly Sci department.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Going to be a Econ/Political Science major. Courseload isn't too heavy, and I like all my professors.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have heard the Center for Profession Development is quite good, but I have not had a chance to use it quite yet. They did, however, help me create a resume.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great professors overall. Very open to helping students. never had trouble with registration.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I did biomedical engineering. Really good program, but not as good of an engineering program as other schoools
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review:
vandyeasya.tumblr.com

Check out this blog for easy classes at vanderbilt!
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I am extremely happy with my major of Medicine, Health, and Society. It is extremely useful for my pre-nursing track and many classes I am interested in can be counted as electives toward the major. I don't have any worry about finding a job as a Nurse Practitioner after I go to the VUSN.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The classes at Vanderbilt are very rigorous and require work but at the same time are rewarding and you learn a lot. The professors are extremely helpful and are willing to meet with any students about questions or concerns. Some classes are easier than others and each class has a different format. Some are giant lectures, others small discussions, and still some in between. I love the balance that there is.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The process of getting into my Medicine, Health, Society Major was extremely easy. I met with an advisor, spoke for a few minutes about my decision and then she signed my major declaration form. It was that simple! There was no criteria, only interest in the program. Anyone can do it and it is a great option for anyone considering anything health related, even Medical School.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am a psychology major and the professors definitely want to HELP. It is a wonderful department and you learn a lot every single day. However, I can say the same for some of the other departments as well. There are very few classes that I have taken at Vandy where the professor does not go above and beyond for the students. However, even though there ARE some professors who are not as helpful, the whole process is a life lesson. Sometimes you have to tough things out on your own. I would not say that any program on campus is perfect, but I definitely think that Vanderbilt academics are superb.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Engineers take mainly the same classes over the first year, so declaring a major right away is not all that important. Once you're accepted into the school, you're accepted into your major program and can change your major at any time.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I don't have too many complaints with the chemical engineering program. All the professors are very knowledgeable, and while they do a lot of research, still find time for students. There are opportunities to get involved with research as an undergraduate.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I think the academics are great at Vandy! I haven't taken any classes that I didn't like and while some were definitely more difficult than others, none were impossible. I definitely think that as long as you take things seriously and get your work done, you should be fine! Also, teachers are really accommodating and they want you to do well, so ask for help! The sciences, especially if you're pre-med or engineering, can be very challenging so be prepared
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I feel as if Vanderbilt has a very large and unique group of majors. One is able to be interdisciplinary (English + History, for example); Medicine, Health, and Society (what I am; essentially public health); or Human and Organizational Development-- to just name some of the more interesting ones.  I am a double major, and I find it very easy to manage.  The faculty are all very loyal to their departments and majors/minors, so you will be surrounded by a group of very supportive folks.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: It really is very program dependent. The music school that I am in has an admittedly pretty easy work load. The math and physics programs here are fantastic and difficult as all get out though. There are a number of education majors that everyone say are ridiculously easy (HOD). The engineering school is pretty tough, having a lot to do with the math requirements. Arts & Science majors can range from pretty rigorous to ridiculous depending on what you're doing. There are a lot of fantastic fun classes to take though. Though unfortunately there are no physical education classes (basketball, tennis, etc.)
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I am a Musical Arts-Voice major at Vanderbilt University. The program is undergraduate students only which opens up a large amount of performance opportunities that I wouldn't have had at bigger schools. I have already performed three leading roles in operas whereas I would be lucky to have even had one small role as a senior at a school like Indiana or Juilliard. The faculty gives a lot of attention and they all work together extremely well. A great vocal education.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Vandy's a grade A school because it's challenging, but the professors are will to help you with any needs you have. I definitely have found it hard most times, but of course there are always those easier random classes that are fun to take and raise your GPA.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Extremely difficult. Vanderbilt, unlike the rest of top 20 schools (minus Princeton, where my brother goes) have grade deflation. Engineering, by far is the most difficult to get a good GPA, I believe a 2.8 is slightly higher than the average engineer. Some majors are able to pass by through with good GPA's, but you still have to be truly brilliant. There's very few dumb people here. Everyone came here with 4.0's and 30 ACTs, so expect getting a few B's and even some C's.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I'm a double major in Human and Organizational Development and Economics, and I feel like I'm being well prepared for whatever job I end up pursuing. All HOD majors are required to complete an internship for a semester before graduation, so of course you'll receive a lot of experience before even getting your degree. Typically, Vandy students don't have a lot of trouble finding internships just because of the school's reputation.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I really enjoy my major, which is Medicine, Health, and Society. It's great because it's interdisciplinary, so I take classes ranging from psychology, to biology, to philosophy. There are a lot of options for classes. I'm planning to go to med school. A lot of people who study MHS go to med school, healthcare administration, or public health. This major provides a lot of job opportunities and doesn't keep you too focused on one track.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There were not any difficulties to getting into my program, which is Medicine, Health, and Society. I just applied to the College of Arts and Sciences and declared my sophomore year. The one difficulty with my major is getting into the classes because they are so popular.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm a Medicine, Health, and Society Major at Vanderbilt, and I really enjoy the program. It gives an interdisciplinary approach to medicine and health instead of focusing on just a science perspective. The workload is not bad, and it focuses more on social sciences. It's nice to be able to tailor the major to what you want to focus on because there are a lot of elective classes for MHS. Possible jobs for MHS majors are medicine, healthcare administration, and public health. Overall, MHS allows you to have a wide variety of jobs in the healthcare field.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There is no separate application process to become an education major (just apply to Peabody College with your regular application). The biggest obstacle is that the education tracks are extremely intensive in terms of number of required classes, so if you switch into an education major after Freshman year it may be hard to finish the course work in 4 years.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As an elementary education major, there are practicum associated with many required major classes, averaging out to about one per semester until Senior year when you student teach. The practicum are like mini student teaching sessions where you are in a classroom for 3 hours a week, observing and teaching lessons in a specific subject area (social studies, math, science, reading, etc). The practicum are amazing experiences where you really get to experience teaching without the pressure of the intense student teaching experience.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I answered this earlier.  I am proud to be a doctoral student at Vanderbilt.  The workload is flexible and the resources are the best.  Vanderbilt Nursing is phasing out its bachelor program and offering bridge programs for those who want to aggressively pursue a Master level study.  They offer a seamless transition from the Master to the DNP or the research arm of the PhD program.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review:
I only know about the nursing programs.  Vanderbilt has a passion for educating nurses at a high level of knowledge and clinical excellence.  It has recognized the need for doctorate level studies to further develop the influence the nursing profession has at the health policy and patient advocacy level.
  Our country is facing some difficult times and the doctor ally prepared nurse has much to offer for the quality of healthcare access and perhaps changing the way healthcare is delivered.
  Vanderbilt has recognized the importance Health information Technology.  Their systems are the best with the most superb technical gurus.
.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am Pre-Nursing. There is no Nursing Major. The school has very few ways to prepare one for any nursing school other than Vanderbilt School of Nursing. There is a pre-nursing society, and 3-2 program. In the 3-2 program you finish your junior year(and the required prereqs) and then transfer into Vandy School of Nursing. But if you want to go to a different school of nursing you're basically screwed.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very little explanation needed here. Vanderbilt has minor grade deflation. The courses are hard on purpose, but college should be hard. Class sizes are small for the most part, but be prepared to sit in a crowd of 200+ students for pre-med classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Vanderbilt is excellent school for academics. Ranked 17 university in the country
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: An Incredible Variety – Vanderbilt is a great liberal arts school and offers an wonderful variety of classes and topics within each discipline. I really enjoy the class topics and I have also been able to form wonderful relationships with professors. There are also several labs that with graduate students and TA's that provide enormous amounts of help.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Very Interesting Class Topics – My major is interdisciplinary and has a wide range of topics and types of professors and I absolutely love that. The only downfall of my major is that it is extremely popular and I do believe that the school properly adjusts for the large amount of students that need these classes and there is always an insufficient amount of seats per semester in the classes for the major. Registration is an extremely frustrating experience. It also seems like many of the classes I need are all offered at the same time making really hard to fill my schedule.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Amazing Prep for Grad Schools – Vanderbilt University has definitely prepared me for my future. I plan to get my doctorate in Conservation Biology and pursue a career in biodiversity planning and design in damaged/destroyed ecosystems (a mouthful, I know). My professors and deans have gone out of their way to find opportunities to improve my chances if getting into grad school and offer any help with academics or anything else. My job is rare, but with the education and experience I'm getting at Vandy, my chances of getting a job in my field is much higher than most.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Small Yet Powerful – The Earth and Environmental Science program is wee but mighty. There are currently 23 undergrad students enrolled in the program. However, the small major greatly works to your advantage. Professors get to know you on a first name basis and do extra work so that you may be successful. I plan to go to Antarctica next semester to work on groundbreaking research with 2 professors and a couple other students. If it weren't for the professors getting to know me (I'm pretty shy), I wouldn't be doing anything like this. I love my major and the professors!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Research and Internships Available – I had an internship this summer, but I had to find it on my own. However, from working hard and getting good grades, I was offered a research position in my major at Vanderbilt. I am currently assisting in groundbreaking research that will hopefully allow me to be published before I graduate. I strongly encourage everyone to get to know their professors and get involved. Although I do not get paid, the experience and opportunity to be published is totally worth it.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: A Lot of Work, but Worth It – Getting into a major at Vanderbilt is a long process, but the process and work that goes into it makes you think about whether it is the major you really want to be in. In the end, it is totally worth it because it either strengthens or makes you rethink your chosen major.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Research Is Mainly It – Research opportuinties are everywhre on campus. I've done it for a year.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Pretty Easy to Get Into – The application process is very straightforward- basically meet with a potential advisor, who is genearlly more than happy to talk things over with you. Vandy does a good job reminding you of when things are due
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: So Many Options and Combos – You can do whateaver you want. Im very ahppy with my program, and i have lots of career options to explore. Not many concerns other than my own fault (lowish GPA)
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Philosphy and Neuroscience – They do a great job of offering a diverse array of courses in their liberal arts approach to undergrad education.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Human and Organizational Development – Fantastic for job opportunities. You can take HOD anywhere and do anything, but that flexibility can make finding your passion for a job difficult. Students get incredible internships through HOD and are paid more than any other major at Vanderbilt after graduation. HOD teaches you to find your own internships, but also provides some help in your search.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Good Professors Challenging Classes – For econ especially, you get challenging professors that definitely help you understand the topic and are helpful during office hours
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Legit Program – Vanderbilt's political science department is one of the best in the nation. Obviously Vanderbilt is only for the intellectually competent, and classes are hard but interesting. Poli-Sci courses generally require a lot of reading, but grades are based on only a few big assignments per semester.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The majority of students do Arts and Sciences however the other schools, Peabody, Engineering, and Blair Music are very good. The courses are very rigorous and sometimes demanding but we have some of the most qualified professors. The ones I had will almost always be available to help and going to class is worth it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Pre-Law offers more hands-on interships and experiences to learn than any other major. The program is extremely successful, especially with those who prefer visual learning to textbook-based curriculums.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Vanderbilt has changed alot, and it can be seen from the upperclassmen to the freshman last year.  While those who recently graduated seemed to fit the stereotype well, the younger classes greatly strayed away from it (likely due to the schools new attempt/success at achieving diversity on campus).  I have met people from all types of ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds, with all kinds of different interests and styles, and can say that my fear of a homogeneous school was irrational.  The guide autor must have wrote his segment a few years ago, before the school turned around completely. I loved my first year here, and with the admissions department increasing diversity even more, along with admission difficulty, i strongly encourage anyone who can get in to attend
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Challenging but Rewarding – I am undeclared and plan to double major in communications and english. The opportunities are endless, as the professors are constantly promoting opportunities that they see fit for their students. The work load is challenging but rewarding, and truly advances you in your area of study with apparent results. It's not hard to find someone else on campus to support you and share your pasison to try and jumpstart your dreams/career
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Most of my classes at Vanderbilt were great.  I was a psych major and loved my professors.  I also had a minor in Spanish which was a very challenging department with dedicated professors.  Even classes that I took solely to complete general requirements ended up being wonderful.  It was a great academic experience.  There is a lot of work because it is a tough school, but everyone takes their studies seriously while balancing it with fun which makes it a great atmosphere.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: There are all kinds of opportunities everywhere! From research at the Medical Center to internships at local radio stations to even parties everynight, there's always an opportunity to Open 'Dores to an enhanced college life and brighter future
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great Professors – Great professors; challenging academics; opportunities for out-of-class intellectual engagement. Workload depends on your field of study, but even the pre-med students are active on campus.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Students will definitely tell you it depends on your major but these professors are some of the best in their field for a reason. Intelligent, challenging, and most importantly to me, helpful and personable. Most of my classes, I actually enjoy learning and professors emphasize learning over grades.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The most beautiful campus. The trees are so pretty in the fall and spring, and sometimes I think about how thankful I am to be on this campus when just walking around its natural beauty combined with diverse architecture.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is a perfect college town. Not too big, not too small. So many fun things to do, awesome food, and friendly people. It's great going to school in a city, but still having a very park-like, suburban campus.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Campus is great. You often forget you're in the middle of city. Facilities are taken care of, and, overall, campus as a whole is stunning.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is quickly becoming the top city for millennials. It's grown a lot in the last few years, and it's predicted to continue to grow.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Its good for night life and eating out. Other than that it is pretty average.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville has plenty to do, and campus life is full of parties if you're into that.  Campus is beautiful with lots of lawns and gives a respite from the city.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is a great city.  There is always a lot going on downtown but I will say some things will be off limits if you are not 21.  I came from a smaller southern city so Nashville seems exciting and big but if you are coming from New York or San Francisco,  Nashville will seem like a suburb to you. Public Transportation isn't great so bring a car is highly recommended if you are looking to really explore the city.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: It's not in the middle of downtown, but a short distance away from the excitement of downtown. Most places surrounding the school are cafes, restaurants, and stores for students.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I don't know much about the local area in Nashville, but from what I've seen, it's been great!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: nashville has so much to do and is amazing. you just need to go around and you'll find something you'll like
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is a great city! Nashville has lots of things going on every day from arts and music at SO many venues to professional sports teams.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is the best! There is so much to do everywhere here! If you love music, there will literally be music at two out of three of the buildings you walk past on the street at any time of day. There are also very many outdoor concerts for free with big name people! I've been here for a few months and I've been to see 3 concerts already!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is great place to go to school
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There's museums and places for people to go if they want to see the town a bit. Bars and lots of shopping areas adorn the area and public transportation is incredible to getting you where you want to go or need to be. Downtown Nashville, near Vanderbilt, is a breeding down for crime and assault, so don't walk around at night. That's the only downside.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Aside from some very old academic buildings and crappy dorms, almost the entire campus facilities are superb. Everything you could want at a university. Several libraries with many places to study that are open 24/7 (which is great during exam week), decent athletic center, great events for socializing, and fun free activities and club performances. The campus is great. Vanderbilt has wonderful facilities and campus life is rewarding and refreshing.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Coming from the deep south, it's been great to have real seasons and to see the beauty of fall.  Summer is a little hot, but other than that, it's great!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I really like Nashville. There is great music, bars, and the Opry
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: You have many options from public transportation to Vandy Van to Zip Cars
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Everything about Vanderbilt's campus is beautiful and full of opportunity.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is a fun town with a lot to do.  You can hear live music anytime you want (not just country).  But you can also enjoy the outdoors and spend a day (or more) hiking in beautiful scenery.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Winter is mild, spring has some rain, summers are hot.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: I never struggle to get anywhere.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: On-campus printing is just starting to be improved. Wifi is great across campus.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Airport is very close by which helps. Not much else in terms of public transportation though.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is the best city to be in for college. Young and hip, it has great food, music and bars. Hometown feel in an urban environment.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It can be really great for those from the North. Otherwise it is extremely unpredictable.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Literally can't get better than Nashville.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I've seen no problems with this.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I'll pick this over Illinois weather every day all day.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's easy and usually cheap to get around town--even free if you're a walker.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: My laptop broke over a year ago, and I've yet to replace it.  The campus provides laptops and iPads to students through the library loan system, and there are plenty of labs available.  The only major inconvenience is the cost of printing, as the one free printing location has been removed.  When the price tag on an education is as high as it is at Vanderbilt, free printing is hardly unreasonable.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Always difficult to find a spot, and once you think you've found one, you get a ticket.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: For the most part, you can use the wireless internet anytime, anywhere.  There are some computers on campus but most people just bring their laptops.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's beautiful during the summer and spring, but it rains during the fall and winters and can get very cold.  I'm from the north, and I feel like I'm still in the north with how cold it gets in the winter.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans only run from 5pm-5am so there aren't many options to getting around campus during the day.  The public bus only runs on the streets outside campus so they aren't the best option, unless you want to go somewhere off campus
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There's a mix of every type of scene in Nashville, so you can always find something to do and find people to do it with.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is the best college town and the best city in general.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Vandy gets all four seasons, but avoids the extreme colds of the winter, and the winter is short. Warm most of the year.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are computer labs, but they are somewhat limited since the vast majority of students have a personal computer. With the amount of work we do, you really need a personal computer. The wireless network spans the entire campus and runs very well and never has problems. You don't need a personal printer since there are printing stations and a lot of students don't have their own printer, however, printing on campus printers costs 5 cents a page so it can get steep if you are printing a lot of material.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Nashville is an amazing city full of friendly people, four seasons, fun activities, fantastic restaurants, lively bars, and most importantly, the most amazing music scene you will find anywhere.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The Vandy Vans run 5pm to 5am. Freshmen have a 10 minute walk to main campus classes, but the Vandy Vans are convenient for clubs meetings or attending greek events.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans are fantastic and they run at various stops around campus from 5 pm - 5 am.  Taxis are always easy to find, as well as zip cars.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Greek life is pretty dominant at Vanderbilt, but it is definitely possible to have a social life without going greek.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vanderbilt overall is constantly renovating its facilities in order to provide the best on-campus atmosphere for all of its students.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's not too cold in the winter, which is nice.  There are definitely all four seasons and mild temperatures in each of them.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Parking at Vanderbilt is not great, we're not meant to be a commuter school.  It's expensive to park and difficult to find open spots.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: You don't really need a car but parking is pretty easy if you want. Just don't park where they tell you not to or you'll get a ticket that isn't enforced so you won't have to pay it.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Very quick and easy ride to airport. Maybe 20-25 minutes
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are so many places to study and relax with friends that I'm constantly discovering new ones.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The party scene is so much fun here that I sometimes have to remind myself that I'm at a top 20 school. The size of the school is perfect so that you recognize a lot people, but there is always somebody new to meet. Classes are sometimes difficult, but the professors are cool and your peers are always willing to help you. Students are diverse in terms of where in the US they come from and the ideas they bring with them from those regions (just as Cornelius Vanderbilt intended when he helped establish the school). Although I probably wouldn't want to live in Nashville when I grow up, Vandy is a jumping point to go anywhere you want.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are a lot of computer labs... but mainly on Main Campus. Freshmen would have to hike to get to those, so I strongly recommend bringing one's own laptop.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is a dynamic city with more than meets the eye.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans and cabs are extremely easy to use (although the Vandy Vans only run after 5:00 pm...). Nashville's airport is incredibly easy to get to and navigate.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Only have Vandy Vans at night, walkable campus
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Best possible balance of social and study life!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Constantly renovating and trying to improve campus
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is wonderful, great food and parks!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: You have to have a laptop to function
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Usually fairly warm, can get pretty rainy. Campus is gorgeous no matter what
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: There are so many options for places to hang out or study on campus, along with the fact that we have food available 24/7 that is on meal plan.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are so many options for places to hang out or study on campus, along with the fact that we have food available 24/7 that is on meal plan.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is an amazing city, with several bars, restaurants, and shops within walking distance of campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans are fantastic, Nashville MTA decent
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: In a great city, great weather, great parties, great academics, great people.  Couldn't ask for anything else.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The local atmosphere is great. There is something for everyone. Great place for anyone who likes country music but Nashville is just a music hub in general. If you're not watching the commodores, Tennessee Titans games are fun! The locals seem to love Vandy!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Just bring your own laptop. Printers aren't necessary as there is many across campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The weather couldn't be better.  From the hot summer days in August/September, the gorgeous Fall days, and the refreshing Spring days, you'll be constantly reminded of the Earth's beauty.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Always something to do, but cabs suck and locals hate vanderbilt students. But we call them "nashtrash" so...
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: everything is useful and pretty.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I don't have a car because first-years cannot bring one so I'm not familiar with the whole system but I hear it's difficult to deal with
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Generally speaking it's a really beautiful and well kept campus
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Technology is generally fine here; although we don't use it in the classroom very much which is disappointing.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville's awesome. It is hard to get around though.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Our main campus student centers and dining halls are all brand new and renovated which give a nice vibe for students.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Most computer labs have Macs that run both windows and mac programs.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: They hand out parking tickets like hot cakes. As you get older, the parking gets better but it is all shades of good. As long as you park in your designated zone, even if its far, you wont get a ticket.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Four mild seasons, doesn't turn into cold winter until just before finals.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Everyone uses laptops, tech support is easy to get and their are printers all over campus that you can charge straight to your student account. Most assignments are online.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Unbeatable campus. Everything is beautiful and state of the art. Facilities make anything possible at Vandy, you get what you pay for and then some.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Its nice to have a car here but not necessary, Vandy vans and zipcars are the way to go freshman year, then bring a car your 2nd year.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville is a great place to live, a lot going on and off campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Absolutely beautiful campus, especially in the fall. Vanderbilt is a national arboretum, so there are plenty of trees and green space. Facilities are all top notch.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It rains sporadically here, but it is nice. We are in November and it is still in the sixties.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: VUprint is extremely helpful in terms of printing something off my personal laptop from a school printer. Computer labs are there if you need them, usually open.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: On campus is best. off campus i have less experience with.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Great local atmosphere. Has everything you would ever need.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It's usually gorgeous. Rarely snows, but wind is super high so that can get cold.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Very green and very high tech. Vandy is building more every day so there's even more coming.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The students as a whole encompass a friendly environment.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Pretty facilities but a long walk to get around campus.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The computers are reliable and user friendly.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: They are everywhere. Rec center, cafeteria, labs. Everywhere but outside. And all computers are either Mac's or PC's. So you have your choice.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Vandy is undergoing major facility changes right now, in terms of everything (dorms, academic buildings, labs, etc.). Even the rec center is completely renovated now.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Permits cost a lot. Ticketing is scary. I was once ticketed three times in a day (I was in class!). Needing a car on campus isn't really necessary because walking is good for you anyway (it's a big campus, but not that big). Finding a parking space can take hours, too.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Nashville reminds me of a preppier version of Austin. The music scene is great of course. The street performers are fun to watch downtown if you're strapped for cash. If you're from a larger metropolitan area, you may not be used to shops and fast food restaurants closing by 10:00 but then again, most people don't leave the Vandy bubble.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's a nice and friendly town. Lots of good concerts and public events such as festivals that are open to everyone.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans run from 5pm to 5am so students don't need to walk around campus after dark if they don't feel secure. Also, all students get free access to the Nashville Bus System (MTA). However, the MTA isn't as big as transportation systems in bigger cities, so the buses may or may not be a practical solution for all transportation needs (takes a long time to get from one place to another.)
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The network is reliable and quick. Vandy has computers and printing stations located in very convenient locations. It is annoying to have to pay for printing but the cost is pretty low. A personal computer is definitely necessary but a personal printer is not.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The bus system in Nashville is a good option for getting downtown or to Green Hills Mall, but it gets complicated very quickly. Most students take cabs to get anywhere that is more than a walk away. The cabs are somewhat reliable, but have been known to get overbooked on busy nights.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The winter was WAYYYY too long for me, especially this year. It was snowing in March! It rains a lot as well, which is pretty annoying since there is A LOT of walking at Vandy. However, when the seasons finally decide to be spring and stay spring, the weather is wonderful. The school year starts off majorly hot though. However, that does not really bother me.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans are free and run from 5pm to 5am in different routes around campus. You can check the current location of the vans on your smartphone which is really convenient. However, they are not always running on time. Nashville has public buses, but most students just take cabs when going downtown or to the airport. Many students have cars at school.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: You don't really need much transportation at all, since anything you could possibly need is within walking distance from campus since we are in Nashville. However, we have free campus shuttles, called Vandy Vans, that run from 5pm-5am every day and stop at multiple areas of campus. Taxis are ridiculously abundant, and they come right up to the dorms and wait for students on weekend nights, and they are the transportation of choice when going downtown. They take our Commodore Cards (school ID cards) so they are convenient since you don't need cash. Many upperclassmen have cars, but most underclassmen do not, as it is not needed. Nashville public buses run frequently, are free to students, and have stops around campus, but are not utilized by many students because they aren't needed. The airport is only 15 minutes away and incredibly convenient and never has long lines.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Public computers and printers are readily accessible in libraries, academic buildings, common areas (dining halls). There are always free computers because there are so many. The only downside is that you have to pay for printing, at 5 cents a page. Everyone has a personal laptop, mostly Macs, but engineers use PCs. We have campus-wide free Wifi that is accessible anywhere, even outside. The network is very fast, reliable, etc. and has no limitations. We even get free or discounted downloads of applications, like Microsoft Word. Most people do not have their own printer, but it's definitely handy.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Most or all students have their own laptop, but each of the four libraries has computers available if you need one. The libraries all have printing, but it can get expensive so owning your own printer is convenient and potentially cost-saving depending on how much you print. The entire campus has WiFi.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The biggest downside is the rain which occurs a lot, especially in the winter. But for the most part the weather is beautiful with a long Fall and Spring and very short Winter. It "snows" once or twice a year, but it is just flurries and never sticks. Spring is the most beautiful weather.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The social scene could be better.  Too many of the parties are fraternity based so non-Greek life people have to make their own, which usually aren't as good as frat parties.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I love the lawns and I definitely appreciate our rec center.  I wish there were more school organized events throughout the year and that we had a more prominent student center.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Parking on Campus is by permit only. Permits for general parking are about $330 per year. Freshman can't have cars.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Campus parking permits or nearby hotel garage permits are rather expensive - I think most are like ~$800/year; however, having a car on campus is truly unnecessary as a freshman especially and for the most part as a sophomore (upperclassmen maybe less so). Also, I had friends park on streets around campus the entire year without having to pay anything. Of course it's a long walk and there's no guaranteed spot, but that could be an option also.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The local atmosphere is amazing! There is always something to do for all types of people.  You can go downtown to the bars, see unlimited musical acts, eat incredible food, visit museums, go clubbing, be a hipster at a cafe, play soccer in Centennial Park, and anything else you can possibly think of.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The computer lab in Garland has a few decent computers-- including Macs.  The Biomedical Library is extremely outdated.  Central Library has many really nice computers.  Printing on campus can be fairly unreliable, and Biomed no longer offers free printing.  The network seems to always be up to speed, and there is wireless access essentially everywhere on campus.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Nashville is a wonderful city with large numbers of music, sports,  and cultural events.  There are also several parks not too far from campus for hiking or canoeing.  That being said, it is often difficult to make enough time in between classes and studying to actually experience all that the city has to offer.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville has terrible allergy problems. The weather can bounce back and forth from warm to freezing cold and it really takes tole on people. The Fall and Spring here however are absolutely gorgeous. The winter is just way too long and way too sporadic.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Not all the computers are equipped to handle all kinds of word documents, so it's kind of hard to convert from your computer sometimes.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It's Nashville so there's always tons of stuff to do off campus but people don't normally go and do it because there is so much happening on campus.  Greek life is huge and there always tons of things going on with that but other groups also put on lots of events on campus and the university gets lots of interesting speakers to come.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There is always so much to do on campus: the biggest problem when it comes to the social scene is deciding what NOT to do. There are always shows to attend-- plays, acapella groups performing, concerts in Nashville, musicians at local venues just to name a few... Every weekend, students receive "Weekend @ Vandy" emails highlighting the events happening that weekend, and it's always filled with formals, fundraising events, movie screenings, and more.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It rains here a lot more than expected, so be prepared with rainboots and an umbrella. Also, many classes can be up to a 15 minute walk from the dorms, so when the weather is bad, the walks to class are pretty miserable. However, when it's not rainy or cold, it's BEAUTIFUL outside.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Computers are good and up to date-- nothing spectacular, though. There are always free computers for use: both macs and PCs.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It really depends on what kind of transportation you mean. We have a VandyVan shuttle on campus that moves students from place to place on campus, but it only runs from 5Pm to 5aM, when people have a chance of getting raped or attacked. The public transportation system in Nashville is decent, but relatively undeveloped compared to that of New York. I think the average of the two would be a B+.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Nashville has so much to offer from pro sports to music.  Many activities on campus.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Parking is incredibly limited. Permit costs are high and you aren't allowed to have a car freshman year (although some people get around this by getting a permit to a garage in one of the nearby hotels). Driving to class is not really an option as most students live on campus and there is no parking near most classroom buildings. Having a car is great if you have an internship or want to explore Nashville, but definitely not a necessity.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's rare to get off campus, especially if you are a freshman. not many things are conveniently located within walking or biking distance. However after freshman year, if you bring a car, you can more easily enjoy the Nashville city scene which is pretty vibrant if you're looking for nightlife. There are always concerts if you can get to them.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nashville is a vibrant and exciting city. There is always something to do in the city, whether it be going out to eat or just walking around.  Being a magnet for music, many big name artists frequent Nashville to play concents.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Ther are very convenient Vandy Vans that run from 5pm tp 5am all around campus to provide safe transportation.  The public bus system is free for students (so are the Vandy Vans) and there are routes that go near a Target, Walmart, and Goodwill.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The Green Dot organization was established to provide safety for women threatened with physical and sexual abuse.  It is centrally managed with outreach safe havens located through out the urban and suburban communities.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Vanderbilt has a reputation as of academic excellence.  It surpasses many universities because of its rich resources in its libraries, research opportunities and commitment to health and welfare.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are a number of impressive services offered by the school. The career center does an excellent job working with students, and the programming board works to plan a number of activities on campus. Because Vanderbilt is somewhat unique as a completely residential college, campus life is relatively centralized on-campus, which makes it very easy to find out what's going on and find something to do.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Parking is very expensive, but is to be expected in Nashville. Freshman can't have a car on campus, although it's easy enough to keep a car parked near campus on several streets with free parking if absolutely necessary. Having a car certainly isn't necessary, but is a great convenience. It's relatively easy to get a parking permit as a sophomore and above.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Music scene is great! great student involvement and religous life opportunites.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: At first, you're just starstruck at everything. However, there isn't much to do in walking distance of vandy. You have to take a cab or bus to go to the mall, and it takes roughly 30 minutes by bus to get to a mall that is very close.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Do not park at Vanderbilt. The permit costs are absurd at around $200 per semester.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The wired internet is quite fast. They need to have more computer labs on campus but there are enough for most students' purposes.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The Recreation Center is always crowded and is very far away from where upperclassmen live. The Center is also somewhat small. The overall campus is full of trees and grass, but also with swarms of gnats having orgies everywhere. Vanderbilt maintenance needs to do a better job with pest control.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: I don't use computer labs but they are available. Internet access anywhere.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Mostly Walking – You can walk anywhere on campus in under 15 minutes, but that's not so fun in the dark or the rain.  The Vandy Vans run starting at 5pm so you never have to walk at night, but you're on your own in bad weather.  Getting off-campus most people take cabs if it's out of walking distance, some upper-classmen have cars, especially if they have off-campus jobs or other obligations since Nashville public transportation isn't particularly stellar.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Doggoned PERMITS! For one thing, permits cost SO SO much. (since they assume that since you are attending Vandy, you have major money to blow.) Freshmen are not allowed to have cars are campus (aka buy a permit) so that is a problem. And then most of the upperclassmen have a car so it's a literal adventure to find a close parking space, especially before class. There are various parking garages around campus-since the medical campus is RIGHT in the middle of Vandy-but student parking is all the way on the top and it's usually only a floor and a half so that is usually filled as well. And Traffic&Parking are vultures when it comes to giving out tickets. It's ridiculous. There are enough spaces...but not enough spaces for the people living there. There are ways to beat the system, but they are well kept secrets. ;)
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Nashville leads to SO MANY fun opportunities! Go to concerts, bars, or the Country Music Hall of Fame. Live music is everywhere. The Bluebird Cafe is a great cultural experience. There are three malls in driving distance that are all great.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans – They run from 5am to 5pm the stops are kind of random. They do go down town on Thursdays and Fridays but they come back at 12 midnight. The Nashville public transportation is pretty easy goes straight to the mall and all Vandy students can ride free.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: As a sophomore, parking is limited to the worst spots on campus. Additionally, having guests come is a nightmare because getting temporary passes is impossible, and so the guest is guaranteed a ticket.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Buses Are Ok, at Least They Are Free – There are virtually no campus shuttle around here but thats because the campus is not so big, however the school gives you a card for free transportaion on genral buses around Nashville. Hence you should be ok getting around
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Cabs Galore – Hailing a cab is quite easy in Nashville, but there isn't much in the way of public transportation. Luckily, walking around Nashville is easy and everything is within an attainable distance.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Monsoon Sreason – Lots and lots of rain, aw well as being very humid
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Not Much Need for a Car – Because Nashville is a city, there isn't much need for a car since we take cabs everywhere if needed. Parking is ok, there are two main garages, one much closer than the other but more expensive. If you just get general parking passes and not for a garage (upperclassmen) you may have trouble finding a place to park. But tickets aren't given very often unless you are parked in a place you're clearly not supposed to. The price is probably average compared to other schools, and you could make it cheaper by choosing parking areas farther away that are less desirable.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Every season is beautiful. Early summer and fall is super warm until around late October. The winters are not bad at all, hardly snows, this year we didn't get snow on the ground at all which I loved. But when it does get super cold or snows, professors may cancel classes since the south doesn't know how to handle snow. Rains a good deal and downpours, but only lasts like 2 days at a time and is quickly followed by sun. We have tornado watches a lot, but have yet to experience an actual tornado any place close.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Tornado Alley – The weather is fairly mild: not too much snow in the winter, doesn't get very hot until after school is out for the summer. However, Nashville gets pretty violent thunderstorms in the spring and these are often accompanied by tornado warnings which can throw a wrench in plans.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Vandy Bubble – Vanderbilt is located in the heart of Nashville, so there are lots of things to do. However, most people don't venture far from campus for some reason. A lot of students jokingly call campus the 'Vandy Bubble' because students hardly ever do things not associated with the school. On the weekends and Thursday nights, several students go to the bars downtown, but that is pretty much it.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vanderbilt is situated in a temperate region. The summers are to die for. During the school year, fall is beautiful, winter is short, and spring is long and lush. The weather is perfectly temperate. It snows no more than about 2 inches in the winter, which is beautiful, but it doesn't stick around too long. It rains in the spring typically once a week, but the weather is gorgeous and everything is green! Vandy campus is a national arboretum with over 500 species of trees! It's amazing!
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review:
Best Technology – The whole campus is equipped with high-speed wireless internet. Each library has an multiple computer labs with all the necessary printers, scanners, and media equipment for academic and personal work. Reliability has never been an issue. Printing under 30 pages at the Biomedical library is free of charge. Everywhere else it is roughly 5 cents per sheet. 
The tech centers are more than helpful as well.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: It's so hard to find parking, I've gotten four tickets this past month! Freshman can't drive, so they either have to park a couple streets over from the commons on 17th or take taxis, borrow cars, and walk.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review:
Definitely a Walking Campus – Tennessee's public transportation system is pretty lacking. There are MTA buses, so if you don't have a car, you do have that option. Vandy also started renting Zip Cars. 
The Vandy Vans don't start running until 4pm, so don't expect to catch a ride to class. Everyone (and I mean everyone) walks here. The campus isn't huge, but you may want to get a bike or skateboard if you have classes on the opposite ends of campus (or two different "campuses").
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Great and Getting Better! Vandy's facilities are absolutely wonderful and they are getting better! They are currently in the process of building an indoor football practice field and indoor track. It will take the place of the Recreation Center and all students are allowed to use it.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Nashville's weather is the craziest weather I have ever seen. One day it is sunny and warm, the next it is snowing. Also, be prepared for snow! It snows here and it gets VERY cold. But other than that, the weather isn't all that bad.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Nashville Is Great! Vanderbilt is located in the heart of downtown Nashville, so there is so much to do not only around campus, but also on campus as well! If you want to attend a football game, the school is located down the street from the Titans' Stadium. Also, pretty much every big concert is held right on campus.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The weather here is beautiful, but you'll need to like it warm. It tends to get humid and rains decently often. Also, if you like snow, Nashville is not the place for you: we get ice.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The entire world's weather is going crazy because of global warming. This winter was much less harsh than the past three years, but Nashville will still fluctuate 25 degrees in a day. Spring is beautiful (awful allergies and a good amount of rain), summer is HOT and SWEATY, fall is wonderful, and winter can get cold (rarely snows).
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Relatively Fun Area – Vandy is on the city outskirts, so it has a very collegiate feel but is close to downtown Nashville.  There are lots of restaurants and bars close by, but unless you're 21 or have a good fake it's hard to go out off campus since most places are 21 and up.  There are a lot of parties on campus though, particularly at the frats.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Not Many Options to Get Off-Campus If You Don't Have Your Own Car. It's not very convenient to get off-campus unless you have your own car. However, even then, you're paying outrageous prices per semester to have a parking spot on campus. The parking spot is far away from where you live normally. It's typically easier to just find a friend to give you rides.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The campus itself is gorgeous, especially in the spring and summer when everything is in full bloom and green
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Fantastic Wireless – You can literally get wifi anywhere on campus, even the back corner of the basement of the science center... great coverage.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Student parking is typical, in a parking garage with a specific spot and the prices are pretty good. There is plenty of parking areas surrounding campus as well so if you are a commuter you won't have a long walk to class.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The computer labs at Vanderbilt are usually available at all times. I have had no problems gaining access to a computer when I need to use one.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Hot Hot Hot – It's hot. Summer up until 3 quarters of fall, and half of spring. Its nice; the guys appreciate underdressed girls, the girls love warm weather fashion and shades. The campus is GORGEOUS. But, frequent rain makes rainboots a necessity, and there is the bad thunderstorms, campus flooding, and tornado watches. Students never get out of class, so we have to deal with both extreme heat and bad rain. In winter, it actually gets pretty cold. Peacoats/trenchcoats necessary. A little snow, and the roads get bad easily in winter because clean up services for snow are limited. Overall, warm weather and a beautiful campus is worth it.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vandyland: the Greatest Place on Earth – Vanderbilt is the most beautiful campus in the world, and everyone, for the most part, always looks very happy on a sunny day. Probably one of my favorite things to do when there is nice weather is to just walk around campus. It's so green and beautiful!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Coming from Chicago, I know what a big city is all about. Luckily, Nashville, although as not a renowned city as Chicago, it still has lots to offer. Between Broadway and Demombreun, there are plenty of bars to hit up.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Vandy Vans – Vanderbilt has a great system of Vandy Vans, which make circles around campus with multiple stops. It's a quick and easy way to get from one side of campus to the other without having to walk. This is especially useful when it's dark at night.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Wireless Access – Wireless is available everywhere, but during peak demand the speed starts to decline. It's best to stay near the libraries where the routers can handle large volumes.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The very beginning and very end of the year are humid and sweltering; November through March are freezing. Second semester is very bipolar- this February was characterized by one week with 3 days of snow and the next week being in the 60s. It might rain/monsoon and be freezing for a couple days then turn 75 F the next day. It is personally difficult to deal with because I'd rather it be consistently mild than both extremes all the time.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The facilities at Vanderbilt are some of the best in the world, let alone the country. The student rec center is enormous and features several courts, weight rooms, machines, pools, and studios. There are at least three libraries on campus with computers, couches, and dining options. Sarratt Student Center features a cinema, art studios, and a coffeshop. Every facility on campus is clean and well managed.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Special Dinners – Squirrel Celebration dinner at the pub, SS Rand, Birthday night every month, Holiday dinner before finals, Hogwarts dinner on Commons... the list goes on and on!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: We Have Seasons! Vanderbilt is in the 80's and 90's when classes first start, but this drops pretty rapidly. Campus is gorgeous in the fall since it is a national arboritum! We've had an abnormal amount of snow this year, which is irritating because Vandy Van service is stopped but classes continue. However, it usually isn't so snowy and it's nowhere near as cold as northern states here, which is a plus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Sucks the Big One – Freshman can't, sophomores might as well not, and upperclassmen have to pay an arm and a leg. If mommy and daddy are footing the bill it isn't bad. The good news is you don't really need it.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Life Outside the Vander-Bubble – Nashville is a great and interesting city, and just nearby Vanderbilt exists a lot of great neighborhoods with cool shops, parks, restaurants and the like. However, many students manage their way through Vanderbilt never taking advantage of any of this. Particularly for the first two years or so, it is a real struggle to find anyone really exploring Nashville as they could - or setting foot off campus at all.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vanderbilt's campus is small enough that there is no daytime student transportation--you're expected to walk or bike to class during the day. At night, there are Vandy Vans that circulate between residence halls that do a pretty good job of making the party scene bearable during bad weather.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: For the most part, the weather is spectacular. However, it tends to rain a lot, since Nashville is down in a valley at the foot of the Appalachians. Besides the rain, the temperatures are glorious and sunny days are to die for.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The food offered at Vanderbilt is much better than would be expected on a college campus. There are several places to eat all across campus, and there are vegetarian options available everywhere. There's even one eatery devoted entirely to vegetarian fare, which is wonderful. There's variety and good-tasting food every day. The only problem is the hours of service - the facility in the middle of campus is only open during dinner hours on Tuesdays and Thursdays, so you're left to fend for yourself on the other days of the week.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The greatest thing about us Vanderbilt Students is that, well... we are very smart, obviously, or else we would not have gotten into this top-ranked school. We do not, however, study constantly. We have a lot of fun, too. Vanderbilt is the ONLY University in the U.S. that is ranked as a top 15 academic school, and well as a top 15 party school. We know how to live a balanced life. We know how to work and how to play.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The "Vander-Bubble&quot – Vanderbilt students tend to stay close to campus- a trend our Chancellor calls the "Vander-bubble." This is most likely due to the fact that over 95% of students live on campus and there are so many restaurants and social attractions close to campus. The local environment of Nashville, however, is fantastic for the college lifestyle when students do leave campus, though, and area attractions such as dance clubs, concerts, shopping, movie theaters, and more are abundant.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Free Internet Access through the password-protected Vanderbilt Wi-Fi network is available everywhere on campus! It is a very reliabile and high-speed service that all students can take advantage of. Personal computers are highly reccommended to take notes with during certain classes, however there are computers in all of the 8 libraries on campus and even in some of the lecture hall buildings that are available for use, and even connected to printers that charge a small amount to each student's personal account when used.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Vandy Van runs from 5pm-4am/5am every night which is great to get around campus (which isn't even that big, so it's just a convenience). There are also always cheap shuttles to the airports during holidays. Cabs are always waiting in Branscomb Circle if you need one, and soon some cabs will be taking the Commodore Card.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Even though the lots are pretty close to the dorms, I always have trouble finding a spot. The permits are also ridiculously expensive
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Nashville is awesome, especially if you like country music. Historic honkytonks like Tootsies and the Stage are a 5 min cab ride away and there is plenty of hoppin night life in the immediate area as well. Its an incredible city to go to school in- and I am from NY- in the past few years it has become very cosmopolitan.
Campus.Author: College Student

Campus.Review: Forget the Summer – Parking is hard and you'll walk till heat exhaustion, you can fall into a heat induced coma wandering around for days looking to get access to different facilities and looking for around for administrators or passing out at the hospital waiting for service
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: All 4 Seasons, but Watch Out for Rain – Spring and fall are gorgeous! And many lawns and a nearby park make beautiful weather very easy to enjoy. But it rains in Nashville fairly often, so umbrellas, rain boots, and rain jackets are a must.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Study Space for All – Vanderbilt offers a very wide array of study-space options. Several buildings across campus are open to students 24/7, including 2 of the school's 8 libraries and many classrooms (which are great for study groups). The Starbucks in the Student Life Center and a virtually silent room off of the main cafeteria are popular and easily accessible. There are also multiple coffee shops, cafes, and book stores within walking distance of campus for those who need an occasional change of scenery.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review:
Work Hard, Play Hard Mentality – If you're intelligent enough to get into Vandy, you should be able to know how to balance a social life with academics, so be prepared to be expected to "be more" by faculty, peers, and upperclassmen. Most students are not only dedicated to their studies, but highly involved in multiple student organizations and maintain very active social lives - be it Greek or Independent. 
Vandy's latent southern feel is extremely welcoming, as are most people on campus - be they from Georgia or Manhattan. Geographical diversity is largely present, and racial diversity is too, students really self-segregate by race and ethnicity. The hoards of Malaysian students contribute to Vandy's "diversity," but they are a prime example of the flaws of academia's desire for greater cultural understanding and interconnecting among students. The Commons living-learning experiment as well as the semester-long VuCept first-year orientation program successfuly is able to pull students from different backgrounds into micro-forums of sharing.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Parking is inconvenient, expensive, and a hassle. Freshmen are not allowed to have cars on campus, though some get away with it by purchasing permits at nearby hotels. Upperclassmen parking has two options: convenient and expensive, or inconvenient and dirt cheap. The office of traffic and parking is a nightmarish, gestapo-like force that is always handing out parking tickets; sometimes you can see them standing in front of a meter that has only a minute left on its time writing the ticket for the exact moment when it expires.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: State of the Art – The computers and infrastructure are all well maintained
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The Best College in the World to Me – i think that the computers at vanderbilt university is not crowded exept for some times when there is exams or other tests.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Many students I know that have graduated have found jobs quickly or have gone on to grad schools of their choice.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Vanderbilt is a school on the rise and our reputation is spreading throughout the country as more and more students are being recruited from the west and northeast. The alumni network is still strongest in the south in areas like Atlanta, Charlotte, and Houston but is expanding in places such as Chicago and New York as well. There are lots of finance/consulting companies that come to Vanderbilt to recruit and I believe that the finance industry tends to do the most recruiting of any group.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I know students fare well in admission into Graduate Programs, but I've heard job placement directly after graduation can be a bit difficult!
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Well, the HOD (basically business majors) students are set up.  The pre-med students also seem to do well.  Other students in STEM majors seem to be "dropped on their behinds."   Often times engineering majors GPA's are too low to even score any internships during their undergraduate careers and find it hard to get in grad school or find jobs in their field afterwards- which is ridiculous.  For the class of 2016, the mean salary for chemical engineers was only $68,000.  Chemical engineering is supposed to have one of the top three undergraduate entering salaries.  For Vanderbilt to be a top fifteen school, that is not a lot at all.  It's mostly because the grading scale at Vandy tends to be lower than other schools.  No one is handing out any A's: a B is the new A, a C is the new B and a D is the new C.  An A in a STEM class is very few and far between.  The problem is that Vandy is not acclaimed as a STEM school, so when you go to career fairs and apply for internships, you're often overlooked because of a low GPA, when truly, a 3.0 at Vandy is basically equivalent to at least a 3.6 at the majority of the schools of the students you're competing with. Vandy is not like an MIT, Rice or Stanford though so recruiters do not recognize this.  I'm a hardworking student, go to office hours tutoring and all that good stuff, but I do feel that engineering majors are screwed over at Vandy.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I'm very pleased with the classes I am taking.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: It's an excellent school, so I'm sure students have many opportunities.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: A lot of school pride so networking is easy as alumni are enthusiastic to connect and help.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Very good alumni connections and prestige, at least in the South and more so in the North now then 10 years ago.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Vanderbilt is an extraordinarily prestigious university. Though prestige is far from being the whole equation, it does say a lot about candidates for jobs and grad schools, and people pay attention to Vandy.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Some programs are more highly ranked and stronger than others, particularly engineering, the sciences, and the education school, Peabody. However, the name 'Vanderbilt' alone can land you an internship or a job, and the connections you make with faculty are so important. Sometimes I wish Vanderbilt offered more support with finding jobs and internships, but at the same time I'm glad I've learned how to manage the ropes myself.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Hoping for the best, only time will tell
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I've met some of the brightest and most driven people while at Vanderbilt. Many of my peers go on to top graduate programs and jobs.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Most people on campus expect a top level job, and achieve their goals
Value.Author: College Freshman
